translated: because faith is acquired through knowledge.

original: rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it removes the stain of the addictions.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //
translated: it makes you glorious through your reception of it,

original: bsten pas blo gros mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: bsten pas blo gros mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: through reliance on it, your intellect becomes supreme,

original: bsten na 'jigs pa med par mdzad //🔽bsnyen bkur bgyis pas bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bsten na 'jigs pa med par mdzad // bsnyen bkur bgyis pas bde bar 'gyur //
translated: through reliance on it, you are made fearless,🔽through service to it, you are made happy.

original: khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //
analyzed: khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //
translated: It makes you glorious through your reception of it.

original: ces pa ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir na dpal du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir na dpal du byed pa'o //
translated: It makes you glorious because it accomplishes the abundance of gods and humans.

original: khyod ni khyod la'o //
analyzed: khyod ni khyod la'o //
translated: You means you yourself.

original: bsu ba ni khyod kyi drung du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsu ba ni khyod kyi drung du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Reception is going to you.🔽Through the application of hearing the Dharma after approaching, reliance is the generation of wisdom through the understanding of what is reprehensible and what is not.

original: nye bar phyin nas chos thos pa'i sbyor bas bsten pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir blo gros su gyur pas na shes rab bskyed par mdzad pa zhes @156a * //🔽bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar phyin nas chos thos pa'i sbyor bas bsten pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir blo gros su gyur pas na shes rab bskyed par mdzad pa zhes @156a * //🔽bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of it makes you generate wisdom.

original: mchog ni khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the special one.

original: chos thos nas bcom ldan 'das dang chos la skyabs su 'gro ba'i sbyor bas brten pa ni gus pa'o //
analyzed: chos thos nas bcom ldan 'das dang chos la skyabs su 'gro ba'i sbyor bas brten pa ni gus pa'o //
translated: The devotion is the application of going for refuge to the Lord and the Dharma after hearing the Dharma.

original: 'jigs pa med par mdzad pa ni ngan song gi 'jigs pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par mdzad pa ni ngan song gi 'jigs pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fearlessness is because of transcending the fear of the evil destinies.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas skyabs 'gro ba //
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas skyabs 'gro ba //
translated: One who goes for refuge to the Buddha

original: de ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro ste //
analyzed: de ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro ste //
translated: does not go to the evil destinies.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the verse.

original: skyabs su song bas 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud pa ni bsnyen bkur bgyis pa ste /
analyzed: skyabs su song bas 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud pa ni bsnyen bkur bgyis pa ste /
translated: The worship is the understanding of the noble path through going for refuge.

original: de lta bus ni de bzhin gshegs pa la kun du bsnyen bkur byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bus ni de bzhin gshegs pa la kun du bsnyen bkur byas par 'gyur te /
translated: By that, one comes to worship the Tathagata,

original: de'i bstan pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsnyen bkur byas pas des bde bar 'gyur ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bstan pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro // bsnyen bkur byas pas des bde bar 'gyur ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: because one accomplishes his teaching.🔽The happiness is the happiness of worship.

original: bde ba ni bde bar bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba ni bde bar bshad do //
translated: Happiness is explained as happiness.

original: de yang 'dir sdug bsngal ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dir sdug bsngal ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa ste /
translated: Here, nirvana is asserted to have the characteristic of the complete pacification of all suffering.

original: bde ba dam pa mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: bde ba dam pa mya ngan 'das //
translated: Nirvana is supreme bliss.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de mdzad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni bde bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de mdzad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni bde bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One who has the nature of performing that is blissful.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad ces pa ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad ces pa ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that one who attains nirvana performs that.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar mes gdungs pa rnams kyi gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir mtshon nus pa can du gyur pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar mes gdungs pa rnams kyi gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir mtshon nus pa can du gyur pa de bzhin du //
translated: Moreover, just as fire is capable of pacifying the burning of those who are tormented by heat,

original: sdig pas nye bar gdungs pa rnams kyi khyod bsod nams chen po'i rang bzhin gyi mtsho chen po ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdig pas nye bar gdungs pa rnams kyi khyod bsod nams chen po'i rang bzhin gyi mtsho chen po ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: how are you, the great lake of the nature of great merit, for those tormented by evil?🔽The response:🔽You are pure by the perfection of morality,

original: bshad pa / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas dag / bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pas dang // shes rab phun tshogs mi 'khrugs pas //
analyzed: bshad pa / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas dag / bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pas dang // shes rab phun tshogs mi 'khrugs pas //
translated: you are undisturbed by the perfection of wisdom,

original: khyod ni bsod nams mtsho chen lags //
analyzed: khyod ni bsod nams mtsho chen lags //
translated: you are the great lake of merit.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas dag / ces smos pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas dag / ces smos pa la /
translated: He is pure by his perfect morality.

original: tshul khrims ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Morality has been explained above.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: His perfection of it is its excellence.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa des dag pa ni nyes par spyod pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa des dag pa ni nyes par spyod pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
translated: He is pure by that perfect morality, because he is free from the stain of immorality, like a great lake free from mud.

original: bsam gtan ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni dge ba ste /
translated: He is meditative, because he is virtuous.

original: thugs rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni dang ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas dang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni dang ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas dang ba ste /
translated: His perfection of it is its excellence.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pas na rnyog pa dang bral ba'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pas na rnyog pa dang bral ba'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
translated: He is clear by that perfect meditation, because he is free from the turbidity of passion, etc., like a great lake free from turbidity.

original: shes rab ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: He is wise, because he discerns things.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs @156b pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs @156b pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: His perfection of wisdom is its excellence.

original: des mi bskyod pas na mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des mi bskyod pas na mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is unperturbed by that perfect wisdom, because he is unshaken by any opposing forces.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyis so sor snang ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyis so sor snang ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ste /
translated: The words of the sutra called “The Infinite Appearance of the Tathagata’s Wisdom”.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i mtsho chen po bzhin no //
translated: Like the great ocean, it is unperturbed.

original: de ltar mtsho chen po dang chos mthun pa'i phyir bsod nams mtsho chen ni bsod nams kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar mtsho chen po dang chos mthun pa'i phyir bsod nams mtsho chen ni bsod nams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Thus, because of the similarity to the great ocean, the great ocean of merit is the nature of merit.

original: bsod nams mang ba'i phyir dper na shing gi rang bzhin gyi shing rta bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams mang ba'i phyir dper na shing gi rang bzhin gyi shing rta bzhin no //
translated: Because of the great amount of merit, it is like a chariot whose nature is wood.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyod sku bltar 'os rin chen te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod sku bltar 'os rin chen te //
translated: Your body is a jewel to be seen,

original: legs gsungs mnyan 'os rin chen lags //
analyzed: legs gsungs mnyan 'os rin chen lags //
translated: Your speech is a jewel to be heard,

original: chos ni spyad 'os rin chen pas //
analyzed: chos ni spyad 'os rin chen pas //
translated: Your Dharma is a jewel to be practiced,

original: khyod ni rin chen 'byung gnas lags /
analyzed: khyod ni rin chen 'byung gnas lags /
translated: You are a mine of jewels.

original: khyod sku bltar 'os rin chen te //
analyzed: khyod sku bltar 'os rin chen te //
translated: Your body is a jewel to be seen,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sku ni kha dog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku ni kha dog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body is color and so on.

original: bltar 'os pa ni bltar 'os pa'i nang na rin chen te /
analyzed: bltar 'os pa ni bltar 'os pa'i nang na rin chen te /
translated: It is a jewel to be seen, among those to be seen.

original: mtshan la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas na dad par 'os pa nyid kyis phan par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas na dad par 'os pa nyid kyis phan par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of offerings because he is endowed with the excellent major and minor marks.

original: mnyan 'os ni mnyan par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan 'os ni mnyan par 'os pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of being heard because he is worthy of being listened to.

original: mnyan 'os rnams kyi nang na rin che bas na mnyan 'os rin chen te /
analyzed: mnyan 'os rnams kyi nang na rin che bas na mnyan 'os rin chen te /
translated: He is a jewel among those worthy of being heard because he is rare among those worthy of being heard.

original: legs par gsungs pa ni phan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa ni phan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is well-spoken because he is beneficial.

original: chos ni legs par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni legs par gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Dharma is well-spoken.

original: de'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: Its meaning has been explained.

original: de yang dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is also the faculties, powers, limbs of enlightenment, etc.

original: de ni spyad 'os rin chen te ;
analyzed: de ni spyad 'os rin chen te ;
translated: It is a jewel worthy of practice.

original: / spyad pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin rnam par spyad na rin po che ste /
analyzed: / spyad pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin rnam par spyad na rin po che ste /
translated: When the nature of the Dharma is practiced, it is a jewel.

original: shin tu phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is extremely beneficial.

original: rgyu de'i phyir khyod yon tan rin chen 'byung gnas legs te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir khyod yon tan rin chen 'byung gnas legs te /
translated: For that reason, you are a good mine of precious qualities.

original: yon tan ni sku la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni sku la sogs pa ste /
translated: The qualities are the body, etc.

original: de nyid ni rin chen de rnams kyi 'byung gnas te /
analyzed: de nyid ni rin chen de rnams kyi 'byung gnas te /
translated: That itself is the mine of those jewels.

original: bskyed pa'i gnas yin pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i gnas yin pa'o //
translated: It is the source of their production.

original: khyod ni khyod do //
analyzed: khyod ni khyod do //
translated: You are you.

original: gzhan yang // khyod ni chu bos 'das pa'i gling //🔽smas pa'i bdag nyid skyob pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang // khyod ni chu bos 'das pa'i gling // smas pa'i bdag nyid skyob pa ste /
translated: You are an island for those who have crossed the flood🔽You are a refuge for those who are wounded

original: srid pa'i 'jigs pas nyen pa'i skyabs //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'jigs pas nyen pa'i skyabs //
translated: You are a protection for those who are tormented by the dangers of existence

original: thar 'chal rnams kyi 'dren pa lags //
analyzed: thar 'chal rnams kyi 'dren pa lags //
translated: You are a guide for those who have lost the path

original: khyod ni chu bos bdas pa'i gling //
analyzed: khyod ni chu bos bdas pa'i gling //
translated: You are an island for those who have crossed the flood

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: You are the Blessed One.

original: chu bo ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chu bo ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The flood is the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: bdas pa ni thar pa'i lam las ring du bdas pa ste /🔽lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa rnams me la yongs su spyod cing tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i chu bos bdas pa ni chu bos bdas pa'i @157a * //
analyzed: bdas pa ni thar pa'i lam las ring du bdas pa ste / lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa rnams me la yongs su spyod cing tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i chu bos bdas pa ni chu bos bdas pa'i @157a * //
translated: Those who have crossed the flood are those who have been carried far away from the path of liberation.

original: gling dang 'dra bas na gling ste /
analyzed: gling dang 'dra bas na gling ste /
translated: Those who are like an island for those who have crossed the flood are like the island for those who are carried away by the flood of the view that holds wrong conduct and asceticism to be supreme, such as Urubilvā-Kāśyapa and others who engage in fire worship.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are an island because they lead to nirvāṇa.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni skyob par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni skyob par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “refuge” is “one who makes a refuge.”

original: smas pa'i bdag nyid ni sems kyi rang bzhin smas pa gang la yod pa de ni smas pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: smas pa'i bdag nyid ni sems kyi rang bzhin smas pa gang la yod pa de ni smas pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: One who has a damaged nature is one who has a damaged mind.

original: sdig pa byas pa'o //🔽de rnams kyi smas pa'i bdag nyid ni sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs pas srog chags brgya stong du ma gsod par byed pa rnams la chos bstan pas dgra bcom pa la bkod pa'i phyir ngan 'gror 'gro ba rnams kyi skyob pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byas pa'o // de rnams kyi smas pa'i bdag nyid ni sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs pas srog chags brgya stong du ma gsod par byed pa rnams la chos bstan pas dgra bcom pa la bkod pa'i phyir ngan 'gror 'gro ba rnams kyi skyob pa'o //
translated: He is a sinner.🔽He is a protector of those who go to bad rebirths, because he established Angulimala and others, who had killed many hundreds of thousands of living beings, as arhats through teaching the Dharma.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa med na yang khas blangs pa tsam gyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i srid pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa gang yin pa de rnams srid pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa med na yang khas blangs pa tsam gyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i srid pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa gang yin pa de rnams srid pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las bskyab pa'o //
translated: He is a refuge for those who are afraid of the fears of existence, such as hell, even without teaching the Dharma, because he protects them from the fears of existence merely by being accepted.

original: de ltar yang lha'i bu gzhan kha cig gis phag mo'i mngal du zhag bdun na bdag skye bar shes nas shin tu dus pas brgya byin gyis bskul bas sangs rgyas la skyabs su song bas dud 'gro'i skye gnas las log cing lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so
analyzed: de ltar yang lha'i bu gzhan kha cig gis phag mo'i mngal du zhag bdun na bdag skye bar shes nas shin tu dus pas brgya byin gyis bskul bas sangs rgyas la skyabs su song bas dud 'gro'i skye gnas las log cing lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so
translated: Thus, some other sons of gods, knowing that they would be born in the womb of a sow in seven days, were very sad. Indra exhorted them. They went for refuge to the Buddha. They turned away from birth as an animal and were born among the gods.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the story.

original: thar 'tshal rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i btson ra las bdag nyid grol bar 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thar 'tshal rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i btson ra las bdag nyid grol bar 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those who desire liberation means those who desire to liberate themselves from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'dren pa ni de rnams kyi 'dren pa ste khyod nyid ni lam mo //
analyzed: 'dren pa ni de rnams kyi 'dren pa ste khyod nyid ni lam mo //
translated: You are the guide of those who are guided, and you are the path.🔽Moreover,🔽Because of pure morality, you are the supreme vessel,

original: gzhan yang // tshul khrims dag phyir snod kyi mchog / zhing gshin 'bras bu phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang // tshul khrims dag phyir snod kyi mchog / zhing gshin 'bras bu phun sum tshogs //
translated: The field for producing the abundant fruit of virtue.

original: srog chags kun la phan mdzad phyir //
analyzed: srog chags kun la phan mdzad phyir //
translated: Because of benefiting all living beings,

original: grogs kyi phul yang khyod lags so //
analyzed: grogs kyi phul yang khyod lags so //
translated: You are the best of friends.

original: zhing gshin 'bras bu phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: zhing gshin 'bras bu phun sum tshogs //
translated: Because of producing the abundant fruit of virtue,🔽You are the supreme field.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: snod kyi mchog ni srog chags kun //
analyzed: snod kyi mchog ni srog chags kun //
translated: The best of fields is all living beings.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained below.

original: tshul khrims dag pa gang la yod pa de ni tshul khrims dag pa ste de'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dag pa gang la yod pa de ni tshul khrims dag pa ste de'i dngos po'o //
translated: He who has pure morality is one who has pure morality.

original: tshul khrims dag pa de'i rgyus shin tu phyag 'tshal ba'i snod kyi mchog go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dag pa de'i rgyus shin tu phyag 'tshal ba'i snod kyi mchog go //
translated: Because of that pure morality, he is the best field for offerings.

original: zhing gshin zhes bya ba ni zhing bzang po'o //🔽'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gang gi phyir khyod la bye ma phul ba yang rgyal po gtum po mya ngan med pa'i 'bras bu'i sa bon du gyur to //
analyzed: zhing gshin zhes bya ba ni zhing bzang po'o // 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gang gi phyir khyod la bye ma phul ba yang rgyal po gtum po mya ngan med pa'i 'bras bu'i sa bon du gyur to //
translated: A good field is called a field of merit.

original: grogs kyi phul zhes bya ba ni grogs bzang po'o //
analyzed: grogs kyi phul zhes bya ba ni grogs bzang po'o //
translated: The best of friends is a good friend.

original: phan mdzad phyir ni phan par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: phan mdzad phyir ni phan par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Because of his helpfulness, he is helpful.

original: thar pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who shows the path to liberation.

original: @157b srog chags kun la zhes bya ba ni lus can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: @157b srog chags kun la zhes bya ba ni lus can thams cad la'o //
translated: All living beings means all embodied beings.

original: khyod ni khyod do //
analyzed: khyod ni khyod do //
translated: You are you.

original: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam la ma zhugs pa de rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa phan par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam la ma zhugs pa de rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa phan par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata is also a benefactor to those who have not entered the path of the Tathagata.

original: thams cad la phan par mdzad pa ni ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la phan par mdzad pa ni ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a benefactor to all because he teaches.

original: gzhan yang / phan 'dogs mdzad pas mdza' bshes te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phan 'dogs mdzad pas mdza' bshes te //
translated: Moreover, he is a friend because he benefits.🔽He is dear because he is pleasant to be with,

original: 'grogs na bde phyir snying du sdug / zhi phyir gcig tu yid du 'ong //🔽yon tan kun mnga' mchod 'os khyod //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde phyir snying du sdug / zhi phyir gcig tu yid du 'ong // yon tan kun mnga' mchod 'os khyod //
translated: he is delightful because he is peaceful,🔽and he is worthy of offerings because he possesses all good qualities.

original: mdza' bshes khyod ni srog chags kun la zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: mdza' bshes khyod ni srog chags kun la zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug go //
translated: You are a friend to all living beings.

original: phan 'dogs mdzad ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thugs la dgongs nas sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang brnyes shing thar pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs mdzad ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thugs la dgongs nas sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang brnyes shing thar pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a friend because he benefits, because he has attained Buddhahood with the suffering of cyclic existence in mind and because he teaches the path of liberation.

original: 'grogs na bde phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khrugs na yang gzhan gyi gnod pa bzod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'grogs na bde phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khrugs na yang gzhan gyi gnod pa bzod pa tsam ste /
translated: He is pleasant to be with because he is patient with others’ harm even when provoked.

original: 'jig rten pa la bzod par grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la bzod par grags so //
translated: Patience with others is well known in the world.

original: 'grogs na bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na 'grogs na bde ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na 'grogs na bde ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de //
translated: Because he is endowed with the bliss of companionship, he is not only blissful to be with,

original: 'on kyang gnod pa byed pa thams cad la bzod pa bstar ba dang / srog chags rnams la yang phan pa stsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa byed pa thams cad la bzod pa bstar ba dang / srog chags rnams la yang phan pa stsol ba ste /
translated: but also because he is patient with all who do harm and because he benefits living beings.

original: bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'grogs na bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'grogs na bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of living with him is the bliss of living with him.

original: rgyu de'i phyir snying du sdug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir snying du sdug pa'o //
translated: For that reason, he is dear.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul snying du sdug pa ni skyes bu rnams kyi yid rtag tu 'phrog pa zhes bya bas na snying du sdug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul snying du sdug pa ni skyes bu rnams kyi yid rtag tu 'phrog pa zhes bya bas na snying du sdug pa'o //
translated: The Buddha-field is dear, because it always attracts the minds of people.

original: mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir gcig tu yid du 'ong ba ni blta bar 'os pa ste /🔽zhi ba'i phyir lta ba dang rjes su mthun pas na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir gcig tu yid du 'ong ba ni blta bar 'os pa ste / zhi ba'i phyir lta ba dang rjes su mthun pas na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
translated: It is lovely to behold, because it is adorned with the major and minor marks.🔽It is like the orb of the moon, because it is peaceful and agreeable to behold.

original: gcig tu zhi ba'i dngos po ni zhi ba ste rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu zhi ba'i dngos po ni zhi ba ste rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: The orb of the moon is peaceful and agreeable to behold.

original: yon tan kun ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: yon tan kun ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: It is the abode of all virtues, because it is the cause of all the virtues that have been explained.

original: mnga' bas mchod 'os zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mnga' bas mchod 'os zhes bya ba la //
translated: He is worthy of offerings because he possesses them.

original: mnga' ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mnga' ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The word “possesses” is a particular kind of verbal action.

original: mchod 'os zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: mchod 'os zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa ste /
translated: “ Worthy of offerings” means worthy of worship.

original: srog chags kun gyis mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags kun gyis mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of worship by all living beings.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang ; sdig pa med pas yid dang 'thad //
analyzed: gzhan yang ; sdig pa med pas yid dang 'thad //
translated: He is pleasing because he is without sin.

original: sku gsung bzang bas dga' bar mdzad //
analyzed: sku gsung bzang bas dga' bar mdzad //
translated: He is delightful because his body and speech are good.

original: don kun 'grub phyir dpal yangs te //
analyzed: don kun 'grub phyir dpal yangs te //
translated: He is glorious because he accomplishes all aims.

original: yon tan legs rten bkra shis lags //
analyzed: yon tan legs rten bkra shis lags //
translated: He is auspicious because he is the good support of all virtues.

original: sdig pa med pas yid dang 'thad //
analyzed: sdig pa med pas yid dang 'thad //
translated: He is pleasing because he is without sin.

original: ces smos pa la /
analyzed: ces smos pa la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: yid dang 'thad pa ni yid dang 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang 'thad pa ni yid dang 'thad pa'o //
translated: “ Pleasing” means agreeable.

original: @158a * // legs pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: @158a * // legs pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: “ Good” means good.

original: srog chags kun la zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags kun la zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: “ To all living beings” is understood.

original: sdig pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dam pas smad pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dam pas smad pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Without sin” means that he does not perform bodily, etc., actions that are condemned by the good.

original: dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: “ Delightful” means delightful.

original: sku dang gsung bzang ba ni dag pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung bzang ba ni dag pa'o //
translated: “ Good body and speech” means pure.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir gsung bzang ba dang mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir sku bzang ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir gsung bzang ba dang mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir sku bzang ba ste /
translated: Because he has perfected the analytical knowledge of language, his speech is excellent; and because he is adorned with the major and minor marks, his body is excellent.

original: thos pa dang lta ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa dang lta ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of excellent is that he is in accord with what is heard and seen.

original: dpal yangs zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur bshad do //
analyzed: dpal yangs zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur bshad do //
translated: The word splendor is explained as the cause of perfection.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kho na la dpal yangs so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kho na la dpal yangs so //
translated: Therefore, only the Bhagavat is splendor.

original: don kun 'grub phyir zhes bya ba /🔽don kun ni mtho ris dang thar pa la sogs pa gang las 'grub pa de ni don kun 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: don kun 'grub phyir zhes bya ba / don kun ni mtho ris dang thar pa la sogs pa gang las 'grub pa de ni don kun 'grub pa'o //
translated: Because he accomplishes all aims,

original: de'i dngos po ni don kun 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni don kun 'grub pa ste /
translated: all aims refers to the aims of heaven, liberation, and so on. He who accomplishes them is the one who accomplishes all aims.🔽The word splendor is derived from the word for accomplishment.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na dpal yangs so //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na dpal yangs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat is splendor.

original: yang na bltas pa tsam gyis gter lnga brgya gzigs par gyur pa dang ; rgyal po gzhan kun gyis kyang de'i yab zas gtsang ma'i sku skyes kyi rgyu mang du bskur bar gyur to //
analyzed: yang na bltas pa tsam gyis gter lnga brgya gzigs par gyur pa dang ; rgyal po gzhan kun gyis kyang de'i yab zas gtsang ma'i sku skyes kyi rgyu mang du bskur bar gyur to //
translated: Or, because he saw five hundred treasures merely by looking, and because all other kings sent many gifts to his father Shuddhodana, he is splendor.

original: des na de'i yab kyis don thams cad grub pa zhes mtshan btags pa de bas na dpal yangs so //
analyzed: des na de'i yab kyis don thams cad grub pa zhes mtshan btags pa de bas na dpal yangs so //
translated: Therefore, his father named him Sarvarthasiddha, which means “he who has accomplished all aims.”

original: bkra shis la legs pa ni bkra shis pa ste /
analyzed: bkra shis la legs pa ni bkra shis pa ste /
translated: “Auspicious” means “good.”

original: sdig pa 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: sdig pa 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: It means “destroyer of evil.”

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?🔽It is explained:

original: bshad pa // yon tan legs rten thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa // yon tan legs rten thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the support of all good qualities.

original: de lta bus rnam pa thams cad dang / gnas skabs thams cad dang / mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i smon lam 'bras bu dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi smon lam la bstod pa bshad do ;
analyzed: de lta bus rnam pa thams cad dang / gnas skabs thams cad dang / mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i smon lam 'bras bu dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi smon lam la bstod pa bshad do ;
translated: In this way, with all aspects, in all situations, and with aspirations such as seeing and hearing, the Blessed One’s aspirations are explained to be fruitful.

original: smon lam la bstod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: smon lam la bstod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the ninth chapter, called “The Praise of Aspiration,” in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: // / lam la 'jug pa la bstod pa ni dbye ba bdun te /
analyzed: // / lam la 'jug pa la bstod pa ni dbye ba bdun te /
translated: The praise of engaging in the path has seven divisions.

original: de yang bshad pa'i skabs su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bshad pa'i skabs su bstan par bya'o //
translated: And that will be explained in the section on explanation.

original: de la / khyod ni rngan thon bgyid la sku la //
analyzed: de la / khyod ni rngan thon bgyid la sku la //
translated: In that, you are the one who acts for the benefit of the world,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad par bya ste /
translated: These two verses are to be explained.

original: khyod ni ngan then bgyid la skul //🔽chom rkun bgyid pa tshar yang gcod //
analyzed: khyod ni ngan then bgyid la skul // chom rkun bgyid pa tshar yang gcod //
translated: You urge the lazy to action,🔽you destroy the thieves of morality,

original: gya gyu can rnams rnal du 'gad //
analyzed: gya gyu can rnams rnal du 'gad //
translated: you set the crooked on the straight path,

original: dal bus bgyid la bzhen bskul 'dabs //🔽dul ba rnams ni lam la sbyor //
analyzed: dal bus bgyid la bzhen bskul 'dabs // dul ba rnams ni lam la sbyor //
translated: you urge the slow to speed,🔽you set the disciplined on the path,

original: dmu rgod rnams la btang snyoms mdzad //🔽de slad skyes bu 'dul ba yi //
analyzed: dmu rgod rnams la btang snyoms mdzad // de slad skyes bu 'dul ba yi //
translated: and you ignore the unruly.🔽Therefore you are the unexcelled🔽tamer of people, the supreme charioteer.

original: kha lo sgyur ba bla med @158b mchog / khyod ni rngan then bgyid la skul ba ni //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba bla med @158b mchog / khyod ni rngan then bgyid la skul ba ni //
translated: You urge the lazy to action

original: kha lo sgyur ba bla med mchog / ces bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba bla med mchog / ces bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: you are the unexcelled supreme charioteer.

original: dper na kha lo sgyur ba'i mchog gis shing rta'i rta dag rngan then ni gom pa gcig kyang mi 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can la lcag dbyug gis rdeg pas skul bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na kha lo sgyur ba'i mchog gis shing rta'i rta dag rngan then ni gom pa gcig kyang mi 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can la lcag dbyug gis rdeg pas skul bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the supreme charioteer urges the horses of the chariot to action with the whip, even if they are in a state of not moving a single step.

original: khyod kyang skyes bu 'dul ba le lo'i dbang gis 'khor bar gnas pa la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ston pa dang zhi gnas skyed pa'i sbyor bas yongs su bskul ba ste /
analyzed: khyod kyang skyes bu 'dul ba le lo'i dbang gis 'khor bar gnas pa la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ston pa dang zhi gnas skyed pa'i sbyor bas yongs su bskul ba ste /
translated: You also are a person who tames beings, who, due to the power of laziness, remain in cyclic existence, and you are one who fully incites them to enter the path of nirvana by teaching them the faults of cyclic existence and the good qualities of nirvana and by generating shamatha.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'dzud par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'dzud par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you lead them to enter the path of nirvana.

original: ji ltar lam las lam gzhan du shing rta 'dren pa'i rta rnams srab kyis blan nas kha lo sgyur bas tshar gcod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar lam las lam gzhan du shing rta 'dren pa'i rta rnams srab kyis blan nas kha lo sgyur bas tshar gcod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as horses pulling a chariot on a path are controlled by reins and are restrained by the charioteer,

original: khyod kyang lam ngan par gnas pa'i skyes bu gdul bya rnams chos bstan pa'i srab kyis tshar gcod pa ni lam bzang po la 'dzud par mdzad ces bya bar dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: khyod kyang lam ngan par gnas pa'i skyes bu gdul bya rnams chos bstan pa'i srab kyis tshar gcod pa ni lam bzang po la 'dzud par mdzad ces bya bar dgongs pa'o ;
translated: you also control beings who are to be tamed and who remain on bad paths by the reins of teaching the Dharma, and you lead them to enter the good path. This is the intended meaning.

original: / ji ltar gya gyu can rnams ni rta 'khyog par 'gro ba rnams shing rta'i kha lo sgyur bas rnal du 'god cing lam drang po la 'god par byed pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: / ji ltar gya gyu can rnams ni rta 'khyog par 'gro ba rnams shing rta'i kha lo sgyur bas rnal du 'god cing lam drang po la 'god par byed pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as a charioteer brings a crooked horse to a straight course and sets it on the right path,

original: khyod kyang g-yo sgyu dang ldan pa'i skye bo gdul bya gang yin pa de rnams rnal du 'god pa ni lam drang po la 'god par mdzad pa'o //🔽ji ltar dal bus bgyid pa'i rta rnams la kha lo sgyur bas bzhen bskul 'debs pa de bzhin du 'bad rtsol dman pa gang yin pa de rnams la /
analyzed: khyod kyang g-yo sgyu dang ldan pa'i skye bo gdul bya gang yin pa de rnams rnal du 'god pa ni lam drang po la 'god par mdzad pa'o // ji ltar dal bus bgyid pa'i rta rnams la kha lo sgyur bas bzhen bskul 'debs pa de bzhin du 'bad rtsol dman pa gang yin pa de rnams la /
translated: so you set those who are crooked and deceitful on the right path, that is, you set them on the straight path.🔽Just as a charioteer urges on a horse that is going too slow,

original: brtson 'grus bstan pas khyod bzhen bskul 'debs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus bstan pas khyod bzhen bskul 'debs so //
translated: so you urge on those who have little effort with the teaching of diligence.

original: kun dga' bo brtson 'grus la brten nas rta bzang po gang yin pa de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur bas lam du khyad par gyi khur khyer bar bya ba'i phyir lam la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du gang gdul bya sha ra dva ti'i bu la sogs pa de rnams kyang gdul bya'i dgos pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lam la sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo brtson 'grus la brten nas rta bzang po gang yin pa de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur bas lam du khyad par gyi khur khyer bar bya ba'i phyir lam la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du gang gdul bya sha ra dva ti'i bu la sogs pa de rnams kyang gdul bya'i dgos pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lam la sbyor ba dang /
translated: Similarly, those disciples such as Shariputra are applied to the path that has the characteristics of the special requirements of disciples to be trained.

original: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu mnyan yod kyi gnas na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba de'i bkas 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi gnas su mu stegs pa mdun du 'gro ba dang mnyan yod kyi skye bo'i tshogs
analyzed: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu mnyan yod kyi gnas na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba de'i bkas 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi gnas su mu stegs pa mdun du 'gro ba dang mnyan yod kyi skye bo'i tshogs
translated: Similarly, Shariputra, the noble Shariputra, by the order of the Buddha, in the Jetavana grove, arranged for the tirthikas to go in front and for the assembly of Shravasti

original: bden pa mthong ba la sogs par rab tu bkod do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba la sogs par rab tu bkod do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'o //
translated: to be established in seeing the truth and so forth, as it is said.

original: de lta bu'i tshig rkang pa gcig @159a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig rkang pa gcig @159a * //
translated: Such a verse

original: dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas zhi gnas bskyed pa sngon du 'gro bas 'phags pa'i lam la 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas zhi gnas bskyed pa sngon du 'gro bas 'phags pa'i lam la 'dzud pa ste /
translated: The first verse shows that the Lord, having generated the concentration of the holy ones, leads them to enter the path.

original: dang po'i dbye ba bshad do //
analyzed: dang po'i dbye ba bshad do //
translated: The first division is explained.

original: ji ltar dmu rgod ni rta mi srun pa rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar dmu rgod ni rta mi srun pa rnams te /
translated: As wild horses are unruly horses,🔽so you are indifferent to the wild ones who have not taken the seed of enlightenment.

original: de rnams kha lo sgyur ba btang snyoms su byed pa de bzhin du khyod kyang byang chub kyi sa bon ma blangs pa'i dmu rgod rnams la btang snyoms mdzad pa ni lam la 'dzud par mi mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kha lo sgyur ba btang snyoms su byed pa de bzhin du khyod kyang byang chub kyi sa bon ma blangs pa'i dmu rgod rnams la btang snyoms mdzad pa ni lam la 'dzud par mi mdzad pa'o //
translated: You do not lead them to enter the path.

original: gang gi phyir de gdul ba'i skabs la ma bab pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gdul ba'i skabs la ma bab pa ste /
translated: Because the time has not yet come to tame them,

original: thugs rje mi mnga' ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽thar pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: thugs rje mi mnga' ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // thar pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i //
translated: it is not that you are without compassion.🔽To those sentient beings who have the seed of liberation,

original: sems can la ston phyag byin pas //
analyzed: sems can la ston phyag byin pas //
translated: you show the gift of homage.🔽With subsequent compassion, you liberate them

original: ngan song dag dang srid pa las //🔽rjes su brtse bas sgrol bar mdzad //
analyzed: ngan song dag dang srid pa las //🔽rjes su brtse bas sgrol bar mdzad //
translated: from the lower realms and from existence.

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis sa bon dang bral ba rnams la dus de srid du btang snyoms mdzad pa ste /
translated: By this verse, he is indifferent to those who are free from seeds for that length of time.

original: dbye ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the second division.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang // khyod ni nyam thag rnams la brtse //
analyzed: gzhan yang // khyod ni nyam thag rnams la brtse //
translated: You are compassionate to the distressed,

original: bde bar gnas la phan par dgyes //
analyzed: bde bar gnas la phan par dgyes //
translated: you delight in benefiting those who are well,

original: phongs par gnas la thugs rje bas //
analyzed: phongs par gnas la thugs rje bas //
translated: you are sympathetic to those who are in trouble,

original: kun la phan par bzhed pa lags //
analyzed: kun la phan par bzhed pa lags //
translated: you are intent on helping everyone.

original: khyod ni nyam thag rnams la brtse //
analyzed: khyod ni nyam thag rnams la brtse //
translated: You are compassionate to the distressed

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //🔽nyam thag pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad par gyur cing nyes pa'i spyod pa byed pa rnams la brtse ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o // nyam thag pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad par gyur cing nyes pa'i spyod pa byed pa rnams la brtse ba ste /
translated: is the elaboration.

original: nyes pa'i spyod pa de las gdon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i spyod pa de las gdon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Distressed means those who have cut off the roots of virtue and engage in evil conduct. Compassion means to be intent on saving them from that evil conduct.

original: bde bar gnas pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba rnams la skal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir phan par dgyes pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba rnams la skal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir phan par dgyes pa ste /
translated: Those who are well are those whose roots of virtue increase. Because they are fortunate, you delight in benefiting them.

original: snying po kho na yin pa'i phyir phan pa'i sgras thar pa bshad do //
analyzed: snying po kho na yin pa'i phyir phan pa'i sgras thar pa bshad do //
translated: Liberation is explained by the word benefit because it is the very essence.

original: de la dgyes zhes bya ba ni bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: de la dgyes zhes bya ba ni bzhed pa ste /
translated: The phrase he is pleased with that means he desires that.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni phan par dgyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni phan par dgyes pa ste /
translated: His nature is to be pleased with benefit,

original: thar pa la dgod par rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar pa la dgod par rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the phrase he strives to establish them in liberation.

analyzed: dge slong dag soms shig / bag med par ma byed cig ces bya'o //

analyzed: phongs par gnas la zhes bya ba ni lta bas phongs pa ste //

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par chad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par chad par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are those whose roots of virtue have been severed.

original: thugs rje ni phan pa la dmigs pa tsam ste //
analyzed: thugs rje ni phan pa la dmigs pa tsam ste //
translated: Compassion is merely focused on benefit,

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'don pa la brtson pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'don pa la brtson pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but he does not strive to rescue those who are not fit vessels because they lack good fortune.

original: kun la phan par bzhed pa ni lha sbyin la sogs pa 'gal ba dang / mgon med zas sbyin la sogs pa rjes su chags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad la phan par bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: kun la phan par bzhed pa ni lha sbyin la sogs pa 'gal ba dang / mgon med zas sbyin la sogs pa rjes su chags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad la phan par bzhed pa ste /
translated: The phrase he desires the benefit of all refers to the fact that he desires the benefit of all those who are hostile, such as Devadatta, and those who are attached, such as Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa thob pa'i phyir dgongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa thob pa'i phyir dgongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: His intention is to cause them to attain heaven and liberation.

analyzed: de lta bu'i @159b rigs su bcad pa 'dis phan pa dang / phan pa ma yin pa dag dang / kun la phan par bzhed pa ste /
translated: This kind of discernment is beneficial, not beneficial, and beneficial to all.

original: dbye ba gsum pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba gsum pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the third division.

original: gzhan yang / khyod ni dgra bo rnams la'ang byams //🔽nyams par gyur la phan 'dogs mdzad //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod ni dgra bo rnams la'ang byams // nyams par gyur la phan 'dogs mdzad //
translated: Moreover, you are loving even to your enemies.🔽You help those who have fallen.

original: gtum po rnams la thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: gtum po rnams la thugs brtse bas //
translated: You have compassion for the violent.

original: khyod ni ya rabs rmad cig lags //
analyzed: khyod ni ya rabs rmad cig lags //
translated: You are a most excellent gentleman.

original: khyod ni dgra bo rnams la'ang byams //
analyzed: khyod ni dgra bo rnams la'ang byams //
translated: You are loving even to your enemies.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: dgra bo rnams ni gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bo rnams ni gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: Enemies are those who do harm,

original: lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as Devadatta.

analyzed: dgra bo de rnams la yang bcom ldan 'das byams pa ni thugs brtse ba'i phyir sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'o //

original: de bas na gdung ba'i rims kyis non par gyur pa'i lhas byin gyi gdung ba'i rims bcom ldan 'das kyi bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bsal to zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na gdung ba'i rims kyis non par gyur pa'i lhas byin gyi gdung ba'i rims bcom ldan 'das kyi bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bsal to zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, by the power of his truth, removed the fever of Devadatta, who was afflicted by the fever of grief. This is the scriptural reference.

original: phan 'dogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'o //
translated: The word benefiting refers to the Blessed One's departure.

original: 'di ni bstan pa la 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa la 'dzud pa'o //
translated: This is the introduction to the teaching.

original: nyams par gyur la zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'i rgyu mtshan la'o //
analyzed: nyams par gyur la zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'i rgyu mtshan la'o //
translated: The phrase who had fallen refers to the reason for his downfall.

original: nyams par gyur pa ni smad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa ni smad par bya ba ste /
translated: One who has fallen is to be despised,

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba'i las spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba'i las spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he engages in actions contrary to worldly norms.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gzhon nu nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba mnyan yod kyi grong khyer gyi phyag dar khrod sbyangs pas 'tsho bar gyur ba bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas rab tu dbyung bar mdzad do zhes thos nas mnyan yod kyi skye bo'i tshogs sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la shin
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gzhon nu nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba mnyan yod kyi grong khyer gyi phyag dar khrod sbyangs pas 'tsho bar gyur ba bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas rab tu dbyung bar mdzad do zhes thos nas mnyan yod kyi skye bo'i tshogs sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la shin
translated: For example,🔽there was a young man named Sthiramati in the city of Śrāvastī who made his living by scavenging in the garbage.

original: tu ma dad par gyur te /
analyzed: tu ma dad par gyur te /
translated: When he heard that the Blessed One had come and would ordain him, the people of Śrāvastī became very disbelieving in the Buddha's teachings.

original: 'di lta bu'i skye bo ngan pa yang rab tu 'byin par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i skye bo ngan pa yang rab tu 'byin par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Even such a bad person as this has been ordained.

original: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'gyod pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal du phyin par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'gyod pa skyed pa'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal du phyin par gyur to //
translated: Then King Prasenajit went to Jetavana in order to feel remorse before the Blessed One.

original: 'phags pa nges par gnas pa de yang rdo leb gang yang rung ba'i steng du phyag dar khrod kyi gos 'drub cing gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nges par gnas pa de yang rdo leb gang yang rung ba'i steng du phyag dar khrod kyi gos 'drub cing gnas so //
translated: The noble Upasena was also staying there, weaving rags on a flat rock.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang khang pa'i yang thog gi sgo bcad nas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang khang pa'i yang thog gi sgo bcad nas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: The Blessed One, too, had entered into meditation, having closed the door to his room.

original: rgyal pos kyang 'phags pa nges par gnas pa ngo ma shes pas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang 'phags pa nges par gnas pa ngo ma shes pas smras pa /
translated: The king did not recognize the noble Upasena and said,

original: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das la bdag mchis so zhes zhu ba mdzod cig ces smras so //
analyzed: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das la bdag mchis so zhes zhu ba mdzod cig ces smras so //
translated: Noble one, please tell the Blessed One that I have come.

original: 'phags pa de yang dgra bcom pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa gzhan gyi sems shes pas rgyal po'i sems shes nas rdo lab de la chu @160a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa de yang dgra bcom pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa gzhan gyi sems shes pas rgyal po'i sems shes nas rdo lab de la chu @160a * //
translated: The noble one, an arhat endowed with supernormal powers, knew the king's mind through his knowledge of others' minds. He then turned the rock into water,

original: la bye'u bzhin 'dzul bar byas shing gshegs nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: la bye'u bzhin 'dzul bar byas shing gshegs nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar mdzad do //
translated: He entered the king's body like a bird, and having entered, he caused the Blessed One to rise from his concentration.

original: de nas rgyal po nang du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos gtugs shing phyag byas nas dang por de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa'i dge slong gang yin zhes zhus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po nang du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos gtugs shing phyag byas nas dang por de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa'i dge slong gang yin zhes zhus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then the king entered and, having touched his head to the Blessed One's feet and paid homage, he asked, Who is the first monk endowed with such great miraculous powers?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: don gang gi phyir 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i slad du 'ongs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gang gi phyir 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i slad du 'ongs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why have you come to give rise to regret?

original: rgyal pos thos nas shin tu dad cing yi rangs par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal pos thos nas shin tu dad cing yi rangs par gyur to //
translated: Having heard this, the king became very faithful and delighted.

original: slar yang de la dad pa bskyed pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /🔽bshad pa mkhregs dang 'jam pa ni //
analyzed: slar yang de la dad pa bskyed pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba / bshad pa mkhregs dang 'jam pa ni //
translated: Again, in order to give rise to faith in him, the Blessed One said,

original: sman pa yis ni yongs rtogs nas //
analyzed: sman pa yis ni yongs rtogs nas //
translated: The physician, having fully understood,🔽gives a medicine that is hard or soft,

original: khrus kyi sman ni ster ba ste //
analyzed: khrus kyi sman ni ster ba ste //
translated: a medicine for bathing,

original: rigs ni yongs su rtog mi byed //
analyzed: rigs ni yongs su rtog mi byed //

analyzed: thugs brtse ba ni thugs brtse bas gzhan dbang du 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: rmad cig lags zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams las 'das pa'i phyir mi shes pa nyid ston pa'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa ni 'gal ba la sogs pa rnams la thugs brtse ba la sogs pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //

original: ya rabs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyid do //
analyzed: ya rabs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyid do //

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dgra bo rnams la yang phan par bzhed pa ste /

analyzed: dbye ba bzhi pa bshad do //

analyzed: khyod ni lhag par phan 'dogs pas // bla ma nyid 'gyur smos ci 'tshal //

analyzed: gal te 'tshal zhes bya ba ni bla ma zhes pa dang sbyar ro // smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ni de ni 'gyur ba la smos ci 'tshal ba'o //

original: bla ma ni bla ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni bla ma'o //

original: khyod ni khyod la'o //
analyzed: khyod ni khyod la'o //
translated: You means you yourself.

analyzed: lhag par phan 'dogs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa thar pa'i grong @160b khyer thob par mdzad pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Special benefit means perfect benefit, because you cause the attainment of the city of liberation without affliction.

original: bshad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: khyod kyang de ltar lhag par phan 'dogs par mdzad ces bya bas na bla ma nyid du brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But you are not able to be called “venerable” because you benefit in that way.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang // rang gi don la mi lta bas //
analyzed: gzhan yang // rang gi don la mi lta bas //

analyzed: nyid kyi dgra bo ltar gyur cing // g-yang sa'i mun gnas rnams la //

analyzed: ra ba lta bur gyur pa'ang khyod //

original: rang gi don la mi lta bas //
analyzed: rang gi don la mi lta bas //
translated: Not looking to your own welfare,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rang gi don ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi don ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de la mi lta ba ni sdig pa la chags pa'o //

original: nyid kyi dgra bo ltar gyur cing //
analyzed: nyid kyi dgra bo ltar gyur cing //
translated: You are like an enemy to yourself.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgra bo dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgra bo dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rang gi don la mi lta bas nyid kyi dgra bo ltar gyur pa de rnams la khyod ni bcom ldan 'das so //

original: g-yang sa'i mun gnas rnams la //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: g-yang sa'i mun gnas rnams la // zhes pa la /

original: g-yang sa ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //

original: g-yang sa de'i mu ni mdun na gnas pa'i sdig pa'i las so //
analyzed: g-yang sa de'i mu ni mdun na gnas pa'i sdig pa'i las so //
translated: The edge of the abyss is the sinful action that stands before one.

analyzed: ngan 'gro 'gro ba'i las byed pa'o //

analyzed: khyod kyang de rnams la bya ba ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir rab lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, you prevent them from doing what should not be done.🔽For the sake of benefiting the two worlds,

analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten gnyis kar sman gdags dang // 'jig rten las ni 'da' slad du //

analyzed: mun par gyur pa'i 'jig rten la //

analyzed: khyod kyis shes rab snang bar mdzad //

analyzed: 'jig rten gnyis kar sman gdags dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam mo //

analyzed: des sman gdags pa ni 'jig rten gnyis kar sman gdags dang po //

analyzed: gang la sman gdags par mdzad ce na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa la zhes rtogs par bya'o // yang na 'phags pa'i @161a * //

analyzed: lam gyis bden pa mthong bas ngan song gi 'jigs pa las 'das pa'i phyir lha dang mi rnams la sman gdags par mdzad pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab snang bar mdzad ces bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //

original: 'jig rten las ni 'da' slad du //
analyzed: 'jig rten las ni 'da' slad du //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'da' ba ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam des ni srid pa'i rtse mo las kyang 'da' ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i slad du ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ste /

analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //

original: dang gi sgra ni /
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni /
translated: The word “and”

original: khyod kyis shes rab snang bar mdzad //
analyzed: khyod kyis shes rab snang bar mdzad //
translated: is for the purpose of indicating that the Blessed One is the one who illuminates wisdom.

original: ces pa ste bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ste bsdus pa'i don to //

analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba de gzhan gyis kyang byas sam zhe na / smras pa / mun par gyur pa'i 'jig rten la //

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: it is said, “In the world that has become darkness.”

original: mun pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mun pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: Darkness is ignorance.

original: de nyid mnga' ba'i phyir mun par gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid mnga' ba'i phyir mun par gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams so //
translated: Because it possesses that, it is the world that has become darkness.

translated: For example, you made the aspiration, “May I become a Buddha for the world of the blind,” and you have accomplished that just as you aspired.

analyzed: mun par gyur pa de rnams la ji ltar yang dag par gyur pa bsal ba'i phyir shes rab kyis snang bar mdzad pa ni skyed pa ste /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes khong du chud par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag la bkod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag la bkod pa ste /

original: dbye ba lnga pa'i don bshad do //
analyzed: dbye ba lnga pa'i don bshad do //

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag la bkod nas /

analyzed: yul la nye bar spyod pa na //

analyzed: lha mi'i spyod pa tha dad kyi //

original: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong bas //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong bas //
translated: But the enjoyment of Dharma is the same.

original: khyod la dbye ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: khyod la dbye ba mi mnga'o //
translated: You are not differentiated.

original: lha ma'i spyod pa tha dad kyi //
analyzed: lha ma'i spyod pa tha dad kyi //
translated: The conduct of gods and humans is different.

original: zhes bye ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bye ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In this passage,

analyzed: tha dad pa ni dngos po gcig ma yin pa'o // nye bar spyod pa na zhes bya ba ni yul la nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “different” means not the same thing.🔽“In conduct” means in the enjoyment of objects.

original: spyod pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: “Conduct” means practice.

original: ji ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: How are they different?

original: lha rnams ni lha'i bdud rtsi la za ba'i longs spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / gnyis gnyis dang / 'khyud pa dang / lag pa bcangs pa dang / dgod pa dang / blta bas 'khrig pa spyod pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams ni lha'i bdud rtsi la za ba'i longs spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / gnyis gnyis dang / 'khyud pa dang / lag pa bcangs pa dang / dgod pa dang / blta bas 'khrig pa spyod pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The gods have the conduct of enjoying divine nectar and the conduct of sexual intercourse through mutual embrace, holding hands, laughing, and looking.

analyzed: @161b mi rnams ni dman pa'i longs spyod kyi spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: de ltar lha dang mi rnams kyi longs spyod kyi spyod pa ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha dang mi rnams kyi longs spyod kyi spyod pa ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: Thus, the conduct of enjoyment of gods and humans is different.

original: chos kyi longs spyod ces bya ba smos pa la //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod ces bya ba smos pa la //

original: chos kyi longs spyod ni bden pa mthong ba dang zhi ba'i gnas dben pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod ni bden pa mthong ba dang zhi ba'i gnas dben pa la sogs pa'o //

original: de'i thun mong ni 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i thun mong ni 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: The commonality of that is just the similarity.

original: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong ba'i rgyu de las so //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong ba'i rgyu de las so //
translated: From that cause of the commonality of the enjoyment of Dharma.

original: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das la'o //

original: dbye ba mi mnga'o ni 'dra ba nyid thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbye ba mi mnga'o ni 'dra ba nyid thob pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: yul la nye bar longs spyod pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: in connection with the enjoyment of objects.

translated: Because of your reliance, the enjoyment of Dharma is similar, so gods and humans have the conduct of enjoying similar objects. This is the summary.

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis lha dang mi rnams lam la 'jug par 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: By this verse of that kind, gods and humans are just similar in engaging the path.

original: dbye ba drug pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba drug pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the sixth chapter on the distinctions.

original: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong yin pa'i phyir lha dang mi rnams 'dra ba yin par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod thun mong yin pa'i phyir lha dang mi rnams 'dra ba yin par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that gods and humans are similar because they share the enjoyment of Dharma?🔽The Bhagavān has said:

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang / na tshod rigs dang yul dang ni //
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang / na tshod rigs dang yul dang ni //
translated: “In terms of birth, age, caste, country,

original: dus kyi skyon med chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: dus kyi skyon med chos rnams kyis //

analyzed: 'di dag kun la sman yon btags // skye ba dang / na tshod dang rigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: They are given the title of ‘physician’🔽with regard to the Dharma.”

analyzed: skye ba dang na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus te zlas dbye ba'i bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi skyon med pa dang re rer sbyar ro //
translated: They are all without fault, each one individually.

original: phal che ba'i gtong ba ni skyon te yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: phal che ba'i gtong ba ni skyon te yongs su gtong ba'o //

analyzed: yongs su gtong ba gang la mang ba zhes bya ba de ni skyon med pa ste /

original: chos rnams rtsis sman yon btags zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos rnams rtsis sman yon btags zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are given the title of “physician” with regard to the Dharma.

original: skyon med pa ni khyad par la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni khyad par la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The absence of a defect is the absence of a special consideration.

original: skye ba la skyon med pa ni ji ltar lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa rnams chos la gzud par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sman yon btags pa de bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: skye ba la skyon med pa ni ji ltar lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa rnams chos la gzud par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sman yon btags pa de bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The absence of a defect in birth is that one is born among humans in order to introduce them to the Dharma, just as one is born among gods in order to introduce them to the Dharma.

original: na tshod la skyon med pa ni rgan po rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: na tshod la skyon med pa ni rgan po rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The absence of a defect in age is that one is born in the prime of life, just as one is born in old age.

original: rigs la skyon med pa ni bram ze rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams so //
analyzed: rigs la skyon med pa ni bram ze rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams so //
translated: The absence of a defect in caste is that one is born in the caste of priests, just as one is born in the merchant caste, the caste of servants, or the pariah caste.

original: yul la skyon med pa ni yul dbus kyi skye bo ji @162a * //
analyzed: yul la skyon med pa ni yul dbus kyi skye bo ji @162a * //
translated: The absence of a defect in country is that one is born in a central country, just as one is born in a border country.

original: lta ba bzhin du mtha' 'khob kyi skye bo rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du mtha' 'khob kyi skye bo rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The absence of a defect in faculties is that one is born with all one’s faculties intact, just as one is born with only one eye or only one arm.

original: rus la skyon med pa ni ji ltar nya'am gnam stong ji lta ba de bzhin bu tshes gcig go //
analyzed: rus la skyon med pa ni ji ltar nya'am gnam stong ji lta ba de bzhin bu tshes gcig go //
translated: The bones are without defect, like the full moon or the full autumn star.

analyzed: chos rnams kyis sman yon btags pa ni chos rnams kyis phan yon btags pa'o //

original: gang yang yongs su spong bar ni mi mdzad de /

original: ya mtshan 'dzin pa med rnams la'ang //
analyzed: ya mtshan 'dzin pa med rnams la'ang //

analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni ya mtshan 'dzin pa'o //

original: ya mtshan che ba lta bu ni ya mtshan che ba lta bu'o //

translated: For example, a noble one born in a low caste, who is truly abiding, is seen by seven hundred goddesses of the Brahma world who have come from the Brahma world to respectfully serve and honor him as he mends rags on a flat stone.🔽Some goddesses
