original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i skyon rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / dbang nyid thob pas kyang yon tan bzhin te yon tan bzhin du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i skyon rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / dbang nyid thob pas kyang yon tan bzhin te yon tan bzhin du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Such faults are like virtues, in that they are obtained by attaining nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, and by attaining mastery.

original: brtson pa mdzad pa ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mdzad pa ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Exertion is engagement.

original: ci rang gi don yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rang gi don yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it for one's own purpose?

original: ma yin zhes @163b bshad pa /
analyzed: ma yin zhes @163b bshad pa /
translated: No, it is explained.

original: 'gro ba'i don slad ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don slad ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: For the sake of the world is for the sake of benefiting beings.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis zhes bya ba'i don gyi tshigs phrad de /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis zhes bya ba'i don gyi tshigs phrad de /
translated: “That” means “by which” in the sense of a causal phrase.

original: brtson pa'i rgyu gang gis brtson par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa'i rgyu gang gis brtson par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of striving by which he strives.

original: de rmad do zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de rmad do zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: “How wonderful!” refers to the perfect Buddha.

original: ci 'jig rten pa bzhin du srid pas de bzhin du brtson par mdzad pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'jig rten pa bzhin du srid pas de bzhin du brtson par mdzad pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is he striving like the world, through existence?

original: bshad pa / ma chags pa'i thugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sred pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs kyis te /
analyzed: bshad pa / ma chags pa'i thugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sred pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs kyis te /
translated: The explanation is: “with a mind of non-attachment,” with a mind free from craving,

original: sred pa rtsa ba nas bton pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sred pa rtsa ba nas bton pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because craving has been uprooted.

original: de rmad do zhes bya ba ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de rmad do zhes bya ba ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “How wonderful!” refers to the non-apprehension of the object.

original: 'jig rten pa shin tu rmad du byung ba yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag 'dra bas bsam par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa shin tu rmad du byung ba yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag 'dra bas bsam par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that “we cannot imagine it, because it is a very wonderful worldly phenomenon.”

original: bcom ldan zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Blessed One” is a term of worship.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Of the Buddhas” refers to the Tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is the one who is called the compassionate one.

original: chos nyid ni chos kyi rang bzhin te thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos kyi rang bzhin te thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the essence of phenomena. The one who is called the compassionate one is the one who has the intention.

original: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis mnyel ba la sogs pa bzod spyod pa'i dka' ba mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po bshad nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis mnyel ba la sogs pa bzod spyod pa'i dka' ba mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the great compassion that is the cause of engaging in the hardships of patience and so forth with such two verses,

original: rten gang gis mnyel ba sku nyams su bstar ba de bshad par bya ste /🔽bshos kyang phal pa gsol mdzad cing //
analyzed: rten gang gis mnyel ba sku nyams su bstar ba de bshad par bya ste / bshos kyang phal pa gsol mdzad cing //
translated: the basis on which the hardships of the body are experienced will now be explained.🔽He also partakes of ordinary food,

original: res 'ga' smyung ba dag kyang mdzad //
analyzed: res 'ga' smyung ba dag kyang mdzad //
translated: and sometimes he fasts.

original: nyam pa'i shul du'ang gshegs mdzad cing //🔽rad rod can du'ang mnal ba mdzad //
analyzed: nyam pa'i shul du'ang gshegs mdzad cing // rad rod can du'ang mnal ba mdzad //
translated: He goes to places of hardship🔽and also sleeps in rough places.

original: bshos kyang phal ba gsol mdzad cing //
analyzed: bshos kyang phal ba gsol mdzad cing //
translated: He also partakes of ordinary food,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: zas ngan pa ni bshos phal pa'o //
analyzed: zas ngan pa ni bshos phal pa'o //
translated: Ordinary food is inferior food.

original: gsol mdzad ni khyod kyis bzhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol mdzad ni khyod kyis bzhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Partakes of means you accept, as will be explained.

original: dper na grong khyer srung byed ces bya bar bram ze'i rgyal po mes byin zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das zla ba gsum mgron du gnyer ba la bram ze'i yul nas mi mngon pa'i gnas su zhugs pa dang / de la byang phyogs kyi lam nas tshong pa 'ong ba de dag las rta chas brnyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol lo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer srung byed ces bya bar bram ze'i rgyal po mes byin zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das zla ba gsum mgron du gnyer ba la bram ze'i yul nas mi mngon pa'i gnas su zhugs pa dang / de la byang phyogs kyi lam nas tshong pa 'ong ba de dag las rta chas brnyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol lo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: For example, in the city called Protector, the Brahmin king called Gift of Fire invited the Blessed One for three months. He entered an invisible place from the Brahmin country. From that, merchants coming from the northern path obtained horse equipment and said, The Blessed One will accept it. This is the avadana.

original: res 'ga' smyung ba dag kyang mdzad //
analyzed: res 'ga' smyung ba dag kyang mdzad //
translated: Sometimes he even fasted.

original: ces bya ba ni dper nas la zhes bya ba bram ze'i grong gi skye bo rnams bdud kyis zin pa'i phyir bsod snyoms gcig kyang rnyed par ma gyur to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dper nas la zhes bya ba bram ze'i grong gi skye bo rnams bdud kyis zin pa'i phyir bsod snyoms gcig kyang rnyed par ma gyur to //
translated: For example, in the Brahmin village called Nala, the people were possessed by Mara and did not obtain even one alms round.

original: nyam nga'i shul du'ang gshegs mdzad @164a * //
analyzed: nyam nga'i shul du'ang gshegs mdzad @164a * //
translated: He also traveled on dangerous paths.

original: cing // zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po'i khab kyi bram ze tshong dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir mnyan yod du phyin par gyur to //
analyzed: cing // zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po'i khab kyi bram ze tshong dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir mnyan yod du phyin par gyur to //
translated: For example, the Brahmin merchant of Rajagriha went to Shravasti to see the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rgyud yongs su smin pa dang ldan par ma gzigs nas rgyal po'i khab tu zhabs gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rgyud yongs su smin pa dang ldan par ma gzigs nas rgyal po'i khab tu zhabs gshegs so //
translated: The Lord, seeing that his faculties were not yet ripe, went to Rajagrha.

original: tshong dpon yang rgyal po'i khab tu song ngo //
analyzed: tshong dpon yang rgyal po'i khab tu song ngo //
translated: The merchant also went to Rajagrha.

original: bcom ldan 'das tsam par gshegs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tsam par gshegs pa nas /
translated: The Lord went to Campa,

original: de bzhin du gnas bcas dang / b'a r'a na s'i dang yangs pa can zhes bya ba'i grong khyer chen po drug tu gshegs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas bcas dang / b'a r'a na s'i dang yangs pa can zhes bya ba'i grong khyer chen po drug tu gshegs so //
translated: and likewise to the six great cities of Vaisali, Varanasi, Kauशाambi, Shravasti, and Saketa.

original: de nas mthong ma thag tu tshong dpon gyis bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas mthong ma thag tu tshong dpon gyis bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then, as soon as he saw him, the merchant saw the truth.

original: rad rod can du'ang mnal ba mdzad ;
analyzed: rad rod can du'ang mnal ba mdzad ;

original: / ces bya ba la mnal ba ni khyod ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / ces bya ba la mnal ba ni khyod ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the uneven places means you is explained.

original: rang bzhin gyi don la ka ta'i rkyen can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi don la ka ta'i rkyen can no //
translated: It has the case ending of the natural meaning.

original: ba lang gi rjes btod pas na rad rod can no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes btod pas na rad rod can no //

analyzed: ba lang gi rmig pas brdzis pa'i 'dam skams pa dang rad rod can dang 'dra bar gyur te /

analyzed: rad rod can de rnams su mnal ba mdzad do ;
translated: He slept in those uneven places.

original: / ji ltar koo sh'a mb'i'i 'brog pa'i bu mo zhig gi grong khyer sde bsangs su rang 'dod pa'i lag can dgon pa pa khyor 'dod pas phas gnyen gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba dang bcas pa lag can gyi gan du dgon par btang ngo //

translated: The forest-dweller, seeing the city of Kauśāmbī, knowing that he was not fortunate enough to see the truth, the Blessed One also approached the forest and lay down on a bed of grass on uneven ground.

analyzed: mnga' mchis pa yang ma lags so //

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /

translated: “The compassionate victors

translated: By such a verse, he explains that he is one who performs difficult deeds by means of these aspects: one who is intent on benefiting those who harm him, one who is intent on benefiting those who seek to harm him, and one who seeks only virtues in those who seek faults.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o // gcer bu ba phal la dad pa khyim bdag dpal sbas kyis dug dang bcas pa'i bshos mdun du bzhag nas khyim gyi nang du me'i 'obs kyi steng du rtsva gcal du bkram pa'i steng du song na bcom ldan 'das mer lhung zhing dug dang bcas pa'i zas kyis
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

translated: The Blessed One, out of compassion for him, went to his house surrounded by an assembly of monks. As soon as he placed his foot in the door, a lotus sprang up from the pit of fire, and the food became free from poison and was accepted by the Blessed One and the assembly of noble monks.

translated: The nectar is the path to the attainment of nirvana,

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad @166b pa 'dis 'gal ba rnams la yang rtag tu phan pa bskyed pas dka' ba mdzad pa bshad do //
translated: This verse explains the performance of difficult deeds by the Tathagata, because he always generates benefit even for his enemies.🔽Moreover:

analyzed: dag pa dang ni skyon rnams med pa dang // sngar med mi la nyes gang byed pa ni //

analyzed: 'khu ba dag ces bya ba ni kha cig tshig mang por zer ba'o //
translated: “Those who are hostile” means some who speak many words.

original: legs pa'i sgras don dam pa'i dge ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'thad do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: legs pa'i sgras don dam pa'i dge ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'thad do zhes bshad do //
translated: The word “good” is explained as meaning “ultimate virtue” and “nirvana is tenable.”

original: de nyid kyis na 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: Therefore, it is the noble path.

original: de nas bde legs kyis ni dpal sbas la sogs pa bden pa mthong bas btul ba dang bzod pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nas bde legs kyis ni dpal sbas la sogs pa bden pa mthong bas btul ba dang bzod pas kyang ngo //
translated: Then, with “good luck,” Śrīgupta and so on were tamed by seeing the truth and by patience.

original: 'o na sdang ba byams pas btul //
analyzed: 'o na sdang ba byams pas btul //
translated: If it is asked, “Then, the hostile were tamed by love,”

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur na /
translated: it will be explained.

original: sdang ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khu ba ste sdang ba'i don can zhes bya ba khams gdon par brjod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sdang ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khu ba ste sdang ba'i don can zhes bya ba khams gdon par brjod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said, “The meaning of hostile is the same as hostile, because it is expressed as ‘to extract the essence,’ there is the fault of repetition,”

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dka' ba mdzad pa'i bya ba'i rnam pa mdzad pa'i phyir gnas gcig tu bde legs dang bzod pa la sogs pas sdang ba btul lo zhes bstan pa dang / gnas gzhan du byams pa la sogs pa dka' ba mdzad pa'i gnas skabs su 'di ni smra ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: dka' ba mdzad pa'i bya ba'i rnam pa mdzad pa'i phyir gnas gcig tu bde legs dang bzod pa la sogs pas sdang ba btul lo zhes bstan pa dang / gnas gzhan du byams pa la sogs pa dka' ba mdzad pa'i gnas skabs su 'di ni smra ba mi rigs so //
translated: In order to show the aspect of difficult action, he says, “In one place, he subdued the hostile by means of good fortune, patience, and so on, ” and in another place, “By means of love, and so on, ” he shows the occasion of difficult action.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: khro ba dag ni bde legs kyis //
analyzed: khro ba dag ni bde legs kyis //
translated: By means of good fortune, he subdued the hostile.

original: zhes brjod pas na de dag gis zlos pa'i skyon shin tu bsal to //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas na de dag gis zlos pa'i skyon shin tu bsal to //
translated: By saying this, he completely removes the fault of repetition.

original: khro ba ni sor phreng can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni sor phreng can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hostile are Aṅgulimāla and so on.

original: mi snyan smra la bden pas te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi snyan smra la bden pas te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of truth, he subdued the slanderers.

original: mi snyan pa smra ba gang yin zhe na /🔽mdzes ma rab tu byung ba la brten nas @167a * //
analyzed: mi snyan pa smra ba gang yin zhe na / mdzes ma rab tu byung ba la brten nas @167a * //
translated: What is meant by slanderers?

original: mu stegs pa mi snyan pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa mi snyan pa smra ba'o //
translated: It is the tīrthikas who slander the beautiful one who has gone forth.

original: de rnams khyod kyis bden pas btul ba dang / dang gi sgras ni bzod pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams khyod kyis bden pas btul ba dang / dang gi sgras ni bzod pas kyang ngo //
translated: By means of truth, you subdued them, and by the word “and” is meant also by means of patience.

original: byams pas ni phan pa'i thugs kyis so //
analyzed: byams pas ni phan pa'i thugs kyis so //
translated: By means of love, he subdued the hostile with a mind of benefit.

original: sdang ba ni gsod pa la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: sdang ba ni gsod pa la brtson pa ste /
translated: Hatred is the desire to kill.

original: bdud kyi bran dar mngag gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi bran dar mngag gzhug pa'o //
translated: They are the servants of Mara, the messengers.

original: de rnams kyi mda' dang mdung thung bcom ldan 'das la 'phangs pa la byams pa la sbyor ba'i phyir me tog gi char du gyur to zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mda' dang mdung thung bcom ldan 'das la 'phangs pa la byams pa la sbyor ba'i phyir me tog gi char du gyur to zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: They shot arrows and spears at the Lord, but they became a rain of flowers, because of his application to love. This is the scriptural authority.

original: de lta bas na 'dir byams pa dang bde legs dang bzed pa'i rnam pa de rnams kyis dka' ba mdzad pa bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir byams pa dang bde legs dang bzed pa'i rnam pa de rnams kyis dka' ba mdzad pa bshad do //
translated: Thus, here the performance of difficult deeds is explained by those aspects of love, well-being, and mercy.

original: gzhan yang / thog ma med dus goms pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thog ma med dus goms pa yi //
translated: Moreover:

original: mi yi rang bzhin mang po yab //🔽khyod kyis ngan song rnams bzlog nas //
analyzed: mi yi rang bzhin mang po yab // khyod kyis ngan song rnams bzlog nas //
translated: The many natures of men,🔽habituated from beginningless time,🔽you have turned them around in an instant,

original: skad cig nyid la yongs su bsgyur //
analyzed: skad cig nyid la yongs su bsgyur //
translated: having averted the miserable realms.

original: thog ma med dus goms pa yi //
analyzed: thog ma med dus goms pa yi //
translated: Habituated from beginningless time,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: thog ma med dus goms pa ni zhugs pa nyid de /
analyzed: thog ma med dus goms pa ni zhugs pa nyid de /
translated: Habituated from beginningless time means engaged.

original: thog ma med dus goms pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med dus goms pa'o //
translated: Habituated from beginningless time.

original: mang po ni rnam pa mang po can no //
analyzed: mang po ni rnam pa mang po can no //
translated: Many means having many aspects.

original: rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Nature is the nature of the passion, hatred, and confusion of sentient beings.🔽You turn away the lower realms

original: khyod kyis ngan song rnams bzlog nas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyod kyis ngan song rnams bzlog nas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: You have turned away the lower realms.🔽🔽

original: ngan song ni ngan 'gro ste /
analyzed: ngan song ni ngan 'gro ste /
translated: Lower realms are the miserable realms.

original: rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gis bzlog pa de ngan song rnams bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gis bzlog pa de ngan song rnams bzlog pa'o //
translated: Turning away is the turning away of those who turn away from them.

original: skad cig nyid ces bya ba ni dus nyung dus so //
analyzed: skad cig nyid ces bya ba ni dus nyung dus so //
translated: In an instant means in a short time.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba ni gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba ni gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Transformation is the change into something else.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa dang ldan par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po thul bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa dang ldan par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po thul bar gyur pa ste /
translated: One who has become endowed with passionate conduct is one who has controlled the faculties.

original: dper na 'phags pa dga' bo'i dbang po thul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa dga' bo'i dbang po thul ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the control of the faculties of the noble Nanda.

original: zhe sdang gi spyod pa dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa la gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi spyod pa dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa la gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: One who has become endowed with hateful conduct is one who has become established in loving kindness.

original: dper na sor phreng bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sor phreng bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like Angulimala.

original: de ltar 'dir yun ring por 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dus nyung bas bzlog pas dka' ba mdzad pa bshad pa ste /🔽dka' ba mdzad pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yun ring por 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dus nyung bas bzlog pas dka' ba mdzad pa bshad pa ste / dka' ba mdzad pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, here, the afflictions that operate for a long time are reversed by a short time.🔽This explains the performance of difficult deeds.

original: dka' ba mdzad pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba ste le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: dka' ba mdzad pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba ste le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the praise of the performance of difficult deeds.🔽The explanation of the praise of the wise

original: // / mkhas pa la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / mkhas pa la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The praise of the wise will now be explained.🔽

original: de la mkhas pa ni shes rab can dang gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni shes rab can dang gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise are those with wisdom and are called those who are inclined.

original: de la skye ba bzhin du skye ba la mkhas pa dang / tshim pa skyed pa la mkhas pa dang / don dang bcas @167b pa'i gsung la mkhas pa dang / rim par ston pa la mkhas pa dang 'don pa'i thabs mkhas pa ste rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya bas na de bye ba lnga'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba bzhin du skye ba la mkhas pa dang / tshim pa skyed pa la mkhas pa dang / don dang bcas @167b pa'i gsung la mkhas pa dang / rim par ston pa la mkhas pa dang 'don pa'i thabs mkhas pa ste rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya bas na de bye ba lnga'o //
translated: Here, there are five types of wisdom: wisdom in the arising of birth, wisdom in generating satisfaction, wisdom in meaningful speech, wisdom in sequential teaching, and wisdom in the means of recitation. With the phrase along with their causes, there are five types of wisdom.🔽Because

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is this?🔽

original: rtsub pa dang 'jam bgyis pa dang / 'jungs pa rnams ni gtong phod dang // gtum po nges par bgyis pa gang //
analyzed: rtsub pa dang 'jam bgyis pa dang / 'jungs pa rnams ni gtong phod dang // gtum po nges par bgyis pa gang //
translated: The rough are made gentle, the miserly are made generous, the violent are made gentle.

original: de ni khyod kyi thabs mkhas lags //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyi thabs mkhas lags //
translated: This is your skillful means.

original: ngang 'jam bgyis pa zhes bya ba la 'jam pa'i rang bzhin ni 'jam pa ste bud pa'o //
analyzed: ngang 'jam bgyis pa zhes bya ba la 'jam pa'i rang bzhin ni 'jam pa ste bud pa'o //
translated: The phrase made gentle means that the rough are made gentle, that is, made to become soft.

original: bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase are made means that they are caused to obtain.

original: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba can no //
analyzed: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba can no //
translated: The phrase the rough means the violent.

original: ji ltar khyim bdag drag po gtum por gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis btul bas dang 'jam par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal po ma skyes dgra la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar khyim bdag drag po gtum por gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis btul bas dang 'jam par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal po ma skyes dgra la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Just as the householder Rudraka, who was violent and rough, was subdued by the Blessed One and became gentle, and likewise King Ajātaśatru and so on.

original: 'jungs pa rnams ni ser sna can no //
analyzed: 'jungs pa rnams ni ser sna can no //
translated: The phrase the miserly means the greedy.

original: dang gi sgros pa'i sa pa zhes bya ba ste bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgros pa'i sa pa zhes bya ba ste bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The word and has a conjunctive meaning.

original: gtong phod ces bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtong phod ces bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase are made generous means that they are made to give.

original: dper na khyim bdag dpa' bo zhes bya ba ser sna dang ldan pas slong mo yang mi ster ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa'i chos bstan pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dper na khyim bdag dpa' bo zhes bya ba ser sna dang ldan pas slong mo yang mi ster ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa'i chos bstan pa las brtsams te /
translated: For example, there was a householder named Vīra who was so stingy that he would not give to beggars. The Blessed One began to teach him the Dharma of generosity.

original: khyim bdag sbyin pa chen po lnga po 'dis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag sbyin pa chen po lnga po 'dis zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Householder, by these five great gifts...

original: sbyin pa gcig kyang nga la dka' na chen po lnga lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes dpa' bos bsams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa gcig kyang nga la dka' na chen po lnga lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes dpa' bos bsams so //
translated: Vīra thought, If even one gift is difficult for me, what need is there to mention five great ones?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa sbyin pa chen po dang ma byin par len pa dang / ji srid 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos pa'i khu ba bag med pa'i gnas las ldog pa ni sbyin pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa sbyin pa chen po dang ma byin par len pa dang / ji srid 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos pa'i khu ba bag med pa'i gnas las ldog pa ni sbyin pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Turning away from killing is a great gift, and turning away from taking what is not given, from sexual misconduct, from false speech, from alcoholic drinks that cause carelessness, up to grain beer and manufactured beer is called a great gift.

original: dpa' bos yang dag par bsams te sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: dpa' bos yang dag par bsams te sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pa yin te /
translated: Vīra thought correctly, and said, This is a gift.

original: bang mdzod mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas na bkur sti byas nas thos pa brtsams te mngon par dad par gyur pas bcom ldan 'das lan bza' zung cig dbul bar bsams nas khyim du zhugs te gos kyi sgrom bya nas na bza' zung cig dbul lam
analyzed: bang mdzod mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas na bkur sti byas nas thos pa brtsams te mngon par dad par gyur pas bcom ldan 'das lan bza' zung cig dbul bar bsams nas khyim du zhugs te gos kyi sgrom bya nas na bza' zung cig dbul lam
translated: Because the treasury is inexhaustible. Thus, having been honored, he began to listen and became very faithful. He thought, I will offer a pair of robes to the Bhagavān. He entered his house, opened his robe box, and thought, Should I offer this pair of robes?

original: 'di dbul lam gzhan dbul zhes sems pa de'i sems bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dbul lam gzhan dbul zhes sems pa de'i sems bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: Should I offer this or something else? The Bhagavān knew his thoughts and spoke a verse:

original: sbyin pa dang ni rtsod pas mnyam par bshad //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ni rtsod pas mnyam par bshad //
translated: It is said that giving and quarreling are the same.

original: yon tan de dag skye ngan la mi gnas //
analyzed: yon tan de dag skye ngan la mi gnas //
translated: Those qualities do not abide in the wicked.

original: g-yul 'gyed dus nyid sbyin pa'i dus yin te //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed dus nyid sbyin pa'i dus yin te //
translated: The time of battle is the time of giving.

original: rgyu bsdus pas ni 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu bsdus pas ni 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: By gathering causes, they become similar.

original: zhes bya ba'i gsung thos nas dad pa mang du skyes par gyur pas mang @168a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gsung thos nas dad pa mang du skyes par gyur pas mang @168a * //
translated: Having heard this teaching, he gave rise to much faith.

original: po ri ba'i na bza' zung bcom ldan 'das la phul nas chos nyan pas bden pa mthong ba dang / rab tu byung bas dgra bcom par gyur to //🔽gtum po zhes bya ba ni g-yo sgyu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: po ri ba'i na bza' zung bcom ldan 'das la phul nas chos nyan pas bden pa mthong ba dang / rab tu byung bas dgra bcom par gyur to // gtum po zhes bya ba ni g-yo sgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The pair of garments of Pori were offered to the Lord, and by listening to the Dharma, he saw the truth and went forth, and became an arhat.🔽Fierce means deceitful.

original: des pa ni rgyud 'jam par bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: des pa ni rgyud 'jam par bgyis pa'o //
translated: Gentle means having a smooth continuum.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bgyis pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bgyis pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: That is to be connected with done.

original: thabs mkhas pa ni sbyor ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ni sbyor ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Skillful means means being skilled in application.🔽Moreover: Nanda, subdued senses,🔽humbly bowing to the proud and haughty,

original: gzhan yang / dga' bo dbang po nyer zhi dang // nga rgyal khengs pa 'dud pa dang // sor mo'i phreng ba'ang zhi bgyis na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dga' bo dbang po nyer zhi dang // nga rgyal khengs pa 'dud pa dang // sor mo'i phreng ba'ang zhi bgyis na //
translated: even Angulimala was pacified.

original: su zhig ngo mtshar skyed mi bgyid //
analyzed: su zhig ngo mtshar skyed mi bgyid //
translated: Who would not be amazed by this?

original: dbang po nyer zhi zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: dbang po nyer zhi zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: Regarding the statement subdued senses,

original: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: the senses are the eyes and so forth.

original: nyer zhi ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyer zhi ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Subdued means not engaging in objects such as desire.

original: de la dga' bo ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mched zla ste /
analyzed: de la dga' bo ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mched zla ste /
translated: Among them, Nanda is the Blessed One's cousin.

original: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba bcom ldan 'das kyis btul bas dbang po dul ba'i nang na mchog tu gyur to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba bcom ldan 'das kyis btul bas dbang po dul ba'i nang na mchog tu gyur to //
translated: Since he was subdued by the Lord Buddha, who was superior to him in the power of merit, he became the foremost of those who have subdued their faculties.

original: su zhig ngo mtshar skyed mi bgyid //
analyzed: su zhig ngo mtshar skyed mi bgyid //
translated: Who would not be amazed?

original: ces bya ba dang thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied in all cases.

original: nga rgyal khengs pa ni shin tu nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i skye bo pa dang ma dag la yang phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung nas dgra bcom pa la bkod do //
analyzed: nga rgyal khengs pa ni shin tu nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i skye bo pa dang ma dag la yang phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung nas dgra bcom pa la bkod do //
translated: The haughty one, who was very proud and did not bow down even to the pure and noble ones, was ordained by the Lord Buddha and established in arhatship.

original: 'dud pa ni dam pa dang rigs kyis rgan pa dang / rab tu byung ba rgan po rnams la yang dag par 'dud par gyur to //
analyzed: 'dud pa ni dam pa dang rigs kyis rgan pa dang / rab tu byung ba rgan po rnams la yang dag par 'dud par gyur to //
translated: The one who bowed down became one who truly bowed down to the noble ones, the elders by birth and seniority in ordination.

original: sor mo'i phreng ba gang la yod pa de ni sor mo'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: sor mo'i phreng ba gang la yod pa de ni sor mo'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The one with the garland of fingers was so called because he had a garland of fingers.

original: de nyid rkun po mi'i sor mo'i phreng ba 'dzin pas srog chags stong phrag gsod par byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis btul lo //
analyzed: de nyid rkun po mi'i sor mo'i phreng ba 'dzin pas srog chags stong phrag gsod par byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis btul lo //
translated: He was a bandit who killed thousands of living beings by seizing the garland of human fingers. He was subdued by the Lord Buddha.

original: sor mo'i phreng ba zhi ba de la su zhig ngo mtshar skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: sor mo'i phreng ba zhi ba de la su zhig ngo mtshar skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Who would not be amazed at the pacification of Angulimala?

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa dang ldan pa dang / dad pa dang mi ldan pa thams cad kyang ngo mtshar skyed par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa dang ldan pa dang / dad pa dang mi ldan pa thams cad kyang ngo mtshar skyed par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha, who is endowed with faith in the teaching, and who is endowed with faith in all things, is amazing.

original: de ltar rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rigs can dang 'jam pa la sogs pa'i rigs can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das skye ba la mkhas pa bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rigs can dang 'jam pa la sogs pa'i rigs can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das skye ba la mkhas pa bshad do //
translated: Thus, in two verses, the skill of the Lord in birth is explained.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyod kyi chos kyi ros tshim pas //🔽gser las bgyis pa'i mal spangs nas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod kyi chos kyi ros tshim pas // gser las bgyis pa'i mal spangs nas //
translated: The steadfast ones, satisfied by the taste of your Dharma,🔽Abandon beds of gold

original: ran mang bting ba'i gnas mal du //🔽brtan rnams bsad nyams nyal bar bgyid //
analyzed: ran mang bting ba'i gnas mal du // brtan rnams bsad nyams nyal bar bgyid //
