original: cha lugs rnams ni gzhan pa'i cha lugs de mdzad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar zhing mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha lugs rnams ni gzhan pa'i cha lugs de mdzad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar zhing mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “He acts” is connected with “he assumes other forms.” The meaning is “he acts.”

original: 'dul ba'i bsam pa ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i bsam pa ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought of those to be disciplined is the intention.

original: de tha dad pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de tha dad pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Different” means attachment, aversion, and so on.

original: der ni 'dul ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yis so //
analyzed: der ni 'dul ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yis so //
translated: The cause of the different thoughts of those to be disciplined is the intention.

original: de la mnyan yod kyi grong khyer du re zhig khyod kyi gsung rnam pa mang ba ste dper na dab phe dab phe zhes bya ba 'jig rten skyong ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa dang / de las gzhan pa rnams la 'phags pa'i gsung gis so //
analyzed: de la mnyan yod kyi grong khyer du re zhig khyod kyi gsung rnam pa mang ba ste dper na dab phe dab phe zhes bya ba 'jig rten skyong ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa dang / de las gzhan pa rnams la 'phags pa'i gsung gis so //
translated: In that regard, in the city of Śrāvastī, he first spoke many kinds of words, such as “dub dūb,” for the different thoughts of the world protectors, and for others he spoke with the speech of the noble ones.

original: cha lugs rnams kyang mang du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: cha lugs rnams kyang mang du mdzad pa ste /
translated: He also assumed many forms.

original: ji ltar dri ba shin tu snyan pa'i nga rgyal bsam pa can du mkhyen pas rol mo mkhan gyi cha lugs dang / ji ltar gzhan pa rdza mkhan kha cig gis rdza sa'i rdza ma 'khor lo las phab ma thag tu skams par gyur pa de'i phyir nga dang 'dra ba rdza mkhan gyi bzo'i slob dpon med do zhes nga rgyal skyes pa de'i bsam pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen🔽pas rdza mkhan gyi cha lugs su sprul nas 'khor lo kho na las so btang ba dbang ba mdzad do //
analyzed: ji ltar dri ba shin tu snyan pa'i nga rgyal bsam pa can du mkhyen pas rol mo mkhan gyi cha lugs dang / ji ltar gzhan pa rdza mkhan kha cig gis rdza sa'i rdza ma 'khor lo las phab ma thag tu skams par gyur pa de'i phyir nga dang 'dra ba rdza mkhan gyi bzo'i slob dpon med do zhes nga rgyal skyes pa de'i bsam pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pas rdza mkhan gyi cha lugs su sprul nas 'khor lo kho na las so btang ba dbang ba mdzad do //
translated: Just as the Buddha knew the conceit of a musician who thought himself very handsome, and so took on the appearance of a musician,🔽and just as the Buddha knew the conceit of a potter who thought, “I am like no other potter, I have no teacher,” and so took on the appearance of a potter and made a wheel spin with just his finger.

original: slar yang sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su mdzad nas nga rgyal dang bral ba de 'dul bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su mdzad nas nga rgyal dang bral ba de 'dul bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, taking on the appearance of a Buddha, he subdued the conceit of the potter.

original: tha mal pa'i skad dang cha lugs gzhan pa de rnams kha cig smod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i skad dang cha lugs gzhan pa de rnams kha cig smod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But didn’t he disparage some ordinary people with other languages and appearances?

original: smras pa / de dag kun kyang dag pa dang / mi 'gal ba dang mchod 'os dang / brjid dang lha mi rnams la ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag kun kyang dag pa dang / mi 'gal ba dang mchod 'os dang / brjid dang lha mi rnams la ni //
translated: He said: “They are all pure, not in conflict, worthy of worship, majestic, and beneficial to gods and men.

original: sman 'dogs bkur ba sha stag lags //
analyzed: sman 'dogs bkur ba sha stag lags //
translated: They are all to be honored.

original: dag pa mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir na dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir na dag pa'o //
translated: Pure, not in conflict, etc. means that they are pure because they do not produce the roots of unwholesomeness.

original: gzhan la phan pa la sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa la sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: They are not in conflict because they are applied to the benefit of others.

original: gzhan @170b la sman 'dogs pa'i phyir mchod 'os te /
analyzed: gzhan @170b la sman 'dogs pa'i phyir mchod 'os te /
translated: They are worthy of worship because they are beneficial to others.

original: rab tu bsngags par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu bsngags par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are worthy of praise.

original: ma rig pa'i rab rib gdon pa la g-yer ba'i phyir na brjid pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rab rib gdon pa la g-yer ba'i phyir na brjid pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are majestic because they are skilled in removing the cataract of ignorance.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni sku'i cha lugs rnam pa mang ba dang / gsung gi cha lugs rnam pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni sku'i cha lugs rnam pa mang ba dang / gsung gi cha lugs rnam pa mang ba'o //
translated: All means many kinds of bodily postures and many kinds of verbal postures.

original: lha dang mi rnams la sman 'dogs pa ni phan par mdzad pa ste bden pa mthong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams la sman 'dogs pa ni phan par mdzad pa ste bden pa mthong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Beneficial to gods and men means acting for the benefit of others, because they cause the vision of the truth.

original: sha stag ni lha dang mi rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: sha stag ni lha dang mi rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: The word only means that they are worthy of the worship of gods and men.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni byed tshig drug pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni byed tshig drug pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase in the present time is connected with the sixth case ending.

original: dag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it known that they possess the qualities of purity, etc.?🔽 It is said:

original: smras pa / smra dang bgyid pa phal cher ni //
analyzed: smras pa / smra dang bgyid pa phal cher ni //
translated: Most of what is said and done

original: legs par rngo thogs ma lags kyi //
analyzed: legs par rngo thogs ma lags kyi //
translated: is not well-performed.

original: bden par gsung ba khyod la ni //
analyzed: bden par gsung ba khyod la ni //
translated: But in you, O Truth-speaker,

original: de gnyis gzhan du gda' ba lags //
analyzed: de gnyis gzhan du gda' ba lags //
translated: those two are otherwise.

original: smra dang bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: smra dang bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: What is said and done is an elaboration.

original: dang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word and has the meaning of because.

original: gang gi phyir phal che ba dang legs pa ni legs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phal che ba dang legs pa ni legs pa ste /
translated: Because most of what is said and done is not well-performed,

original: rngo mi thogs pa dang / phal che ba dang / legs par smra ba yang rngo mi thogs pa'o //
analyzed: rngo mi thogs pa dang / phal che ba dang / legs par smra ba yang rngo mi thogs pa'o //
translated: it is not well-performed, it is not most, it is not well-said, and it is not well-done.

original: gzan yang 'jig rten pa kha cig legs par byed pa'am legs par smra ba ste /
analyzed: gzan yang 'jig rten pa kha cig legs par byed pa'am legs par smra ba ste /
translated: Some worldly people say well-done or well-said.

original: khyod la gzhan du zhes bya ba ni cha lugs rnam pa mang po dang / gsung rnam pa mang po la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams kyis logs par gda' ba lags so //
analyzed: khyod la gzhan du zhes bya ba ni cha lugs rnam pa mang po dang / gsung rnam pa mang po la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams kyis logs par gda' ba lags so //
translated: The other is the many kinds of dress, the many kinds of speech, and so on, by which the practices previously explained are carried out.

original: phyin ci log pa'i gsang mi mnga' ba'i phyir bden pa gsung ba zhes bod pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i gsang mi mnga' ba'i phyir bden pa gsung ba zhes bod pa'o //
translated: Because he is not ignorant of the secret of the perverse, he is called the one who speaks the truth.

original: gda' ba zhes bya ba ni gda' ba'o //
analyzed: gda' ba zhes bya ba ni gda' ba'o //
translated: The word is means exists.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The two are as previously explained.

original: phal che ba dang legs pa ni bgyid pa dang gsung ba'o //
analyzed: phal che ba dang legs pa ni bgyid pa dang gsung ba'o //
translated: The most and good are the doing and the speaking.

original: de'i phyir sku'i cha lugs rnam mang zhes bya ba ni sngar legs par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sku'i cha lugs rnam mang zhes bya ba ni sngar legs par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the many kinds of dress of the body are as previously well explained.

original: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa de rnams kyis dag pa'i sku dang gsung gi sgrub pas rgyu dang bcas pa'i drang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa de rnams kyis dag pa'i sku dang gsung gi sgrub pas rgyu dang bcas pa'i drang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid bshad do //
translated: By these verses, the skill in means of the guidance together with its cause is explained by the accomplishment of the pure body and speech.

original: de ni bya ba med na yang sems can drang ba la mkhas pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bya ba med na yang sems can drang ba la mkhas pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the skill in guiding sentient beings should be explained, even though it is not a function.

original: bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig gis //
analyzed: bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig gis //
translated: You alone, O Pure One,

original: khyod kyis 'gro ba'i dpal zhing mdzad //🔽'di ltar rnam pa 'di 'dra zhing //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'gro ba'i dpal zhing mdzad // 'di ltar rnam pa 'di 'dra zhing //
translated: are the glory of the world.

original: 'jig rten gsum na mchis ma lags //🔽thog med srid pa nyam nga bar //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na mchis ma lags // thog med srid pa nyam nga bar //
translated: There is no one in the three worlds

original: snga nas gcig tu nyams pa yi //
analyzed: snga nas gcig tu nyams pa yi //
translated: who is like you in these aspects.

original: sems can kun la @171a * //🔽sman slad du //
analyzed: sems can kun la @171a * // sman slad du //
translated: For the sake of all beings,🔽you strive in this way

original: khyod ni de ltar brtson pa lags //
analyzed: khyod ni de ltar brtson pa lags //
translated: to heal the long-standing,🔽deeply rooted,🔽painful, and beginningless🔽existence.

original: bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig gis //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig gis // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: You alone, O Pure One,🔽are the glory of the world.

original: bya ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir bdag nyid 'ba' zhig ni thugs kyi dag pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir bdag nyid 'ba' zhig ni thugs kyi dag pa ste /
translated: The two verses beginning with the words “You alone, O Pure One” show the purity of the Buddha’s mind and body.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma ma lus pa spangs pas na bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig nges so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma ma lus pa spangs pas na bdag nyid dag pa 'ba' zhig nges so //
translated: Because he has no duties to perform, he is “pure by nature,” because he has abandoned all the stains of the afflictions together with their propensities.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa la'o //🔽dpal zhing mdzad ces bya ba ni dag byed du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa la'o // dpal zhing mdzad ces bya ba ni dag byed du mdzad pa ste /
translated: The word “alone” indicates that he is the only one who is pure.

original: mtho ris kyi lam la 'god par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi lam la 'god par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Glory of the world” means that he is the purifier, because he establishes beings in the path to heaven.

original: 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristic of a living being has already been explained.

original: mdzad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i don la ling gi rkyen dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdzad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i don la ling gi rkyen dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word makes is connected with the word in the world.🔽From what?

original: gang las de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: The answer is:

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar rnam pa 'di 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar rnam pa 'di 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la //
translated: Thus, of such a kind, etc.

original: 'di ltar ni rnam pa 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni rnam pa 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Thus, of such a kind means:

original: skyon thams cad mi mnga' ba dang yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa yang sngar bshad do //
analyzed: skyon thams cad mi mnga' ba dang yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa yang sngar bshad do //
translated: As has been explained, free from all faults and endowed with all virtues.

original: zhing ni 'dir mtho ris dang thar pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: zhing ni 'dir mtho ris dang thar pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas so //
translated: The field here is the place of attaining the fruit of heaven and liberation.

original: 'jig rten gsum dag ni khams gsum dag na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum dag ni khams gsum dag na'o //
translated: In the three worlds means in the three realms.

original: mchis pa ni ma lags pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mchis pa ni ma lags pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word is is connected with the word not.

original: de'i phyir na bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba byed pas 'gro ba'i dpal zhing du mdzad pa'o //🔽thog med srid pa nyam nga bar //
analyzed: de'i phyir na bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba byed pas 'gro ba'i dpal zhing du mdzad pa'o // thog med srid pa nyam nga bar //
translated: Therefore, by making praise and homage, the Blessed One makes the field of the world's glory.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The verse beginning In beginningless and fearful existence is stated.

original: thog med ces bya ba ni khas blangs pa'i tshig phrad do //
analyzed: thog med ces bya ba ni khas blangs pa'i tshig phrad do //
translated: Beginningless is a verbal prefix.

original: gcig tu nyams pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyud gzir ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nyams pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyud gzir ba'o //
translated: The single degeneration is the oppression of the continuum by birth, aging, sickness, death, etc.

original: skye ba thog ma med pa'i phyir thog med srid pa nyam nga bar ro //🔽srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba thog ma med pa'i phyir thog med srid pa nyam nga bar ro // srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Since birth is beginningless, it is in beginningless, miserable existence.

original: de nyid skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang ldan pa'i phyir nyam nga ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang ldan pa'i phyir nyam nga ba'o //
translated: Existence is samsara, and it is miserable because it is endowed with birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: sman slad du zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sman slad du zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of medicine means for the sake of abandoning all suffering.

original: sems can kun la zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma rtogs pa'i lus can rnams la'o //
analyzed: sems can kun la zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma rtogs pa'i lus can rnams la'o //
translated: To all sentient beings means to embodied beings who have not realized the distinction.

original: sngar bshad pa'i cha lugs dang gsung gzhan la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i cha lugs dang gsung gzhan la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: By means of the attire, speech, and so on explained above, you, the Blessed One, have perfectly entered into.

original: des na shin tu drang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na shin tu drang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called skill in means.

original: mkhas pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa la bstod pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the praise of skill.

original: mkhas pa la bstod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: mkhas pa la bstod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter, having twelve verses, called “the praise of the wise.🔽”

original: // / bu lon med @171b par bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / bu lon med @171b par bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the praise of being debt-free will be explained.

original: bu lon ni nges par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bu lon ni nges par bya ba ste /
translated: “Debt” is what must be repaid.

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir bu lon med pa ste /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir bu lon med pa ste /
translated: In order to repay it, one is “debt-free.”

original: de'i rang bzhin ni bu lon med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni bu lon med pa'o //
translated: Its nature is being debt-free.

original: de la bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la bkod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs sku'i dbye ba'i phyir sems can rnams la bu lon med par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la bkod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs sku'i dbye ba'i phyir sems can rnams la bu lon med par bshad par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, one should explain being debt-free to sentient beings in order to conquer the demons, in order to establish them in the holy Dharma, and in order to distinguish the form body.

original: de la 'dir re zhig 'dir gleng bslang ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig 'dir gleng bslang ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, first of all, here the introduction should be explained.🔽“You should not think that there is any practice

original: gang gis khyod drin lan lon pa'i //🔽sgrub de mchis snyam ma bgyid de //
analyzed: gang gis khyod drin lan lon pa'i // sgrub de mchis snyam ma bgyid de //
translated: by which you can repay their kindness.

original: skye bo 'ang gang dag mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: skye bo 'ang gang dag mya ngan 'das //
translated: Even those beings who have attained nirvana

original: de dag gis kyang lan ma lon //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang lan ma lon //
translated: have not repaid their debt.🔽Those who abide in your Dharma

original: khyod kyi chos la gnas de dag / rang don kho na bgyid par bas //
analyzed: khyod kyi chos la gnas de dag / rang don kho na bgyid par bas //
translated: are thought to be acting only in their own self-interest.

original: de'i slad du 'o brgyal gang //
analyzed: de'i slad du 'o brgyal gang //
translated: Therefore, what trouble is there

original: de la lan go ci zhig lon //
analyzed: de la lan go ci zhig lon //
translated: What is the reply to that?

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa ste //
translated: “Accomplishment” is the accomplishment.

original: de mchis snyam mi bgyid ces bya ba ni ma mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de mchis snyam mi bgyid ces bya ba ni ma mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: “I do not think that it exists” is “I do not see.”

original: bstod pa mkhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa mkhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: This is what the Praiser says.

original: ji ltar sgrub par 'gyur ba ni sgrub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par 'gyur ba ni sgrub ces bya ba'o //
translated: “How will there be accomplishment?” is “accomplishment.”

original: drin ni phan pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: drin ni phan pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: “Kindness” is “benefit.” This is the intention.

original: 'o na bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung bskyangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drin la lan glon pa ma yin nam zhan //🔽smras pa / skye bo'ang gang dag mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'o na bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung bskyangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drin la lan glon pa ma yin nam zhan // smras pa / skye bo'ang gang dag mya ngan 'das //
translated: “Well then, since the one who maintains the speech of the Sugata is nirvana, isn’t that repaying the kindness of the Bhagavat?”🔽He says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: “Those beings who are in nirvana” and so on.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan te /
translated: The word “also” teaches the greatness of the self.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni sha ra dva ti'i bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni sha ra dva ti'i bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those” refers to Śāradvatīputra and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang skye ba zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang skye ba zad par byed pa'o //
translated: “Nirvana” is the exhaustion of afflictions and birth.

original: de dag gis kyang lan ma lon pa ni de dag bu lon chags pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang lan ma lon pa ni de dag bu lon chags pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not repay them are in debt to them.

original: lan ma lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan ma lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not repay them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / khyod kyi chos la gnas de dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te khyod kyi chos ni khyod kyi bstan pa la gnas pa yang rang don kho nar nyon mongs pa zad par byed cing de bzhin du gzhan gyi don mi byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa / khyod kyi chos la gnas de dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te khyod kyi chos ni khyod kyi bstan pa la gnas pa yang rang don kho nar nyon mongs pa zad par byed cing de bzhin du gzhan gyi don mi byed do //
translated: The verse says, “Those who abide in your Dharma,” and so on. If your Dharma is to abide in your teaching, it is only for one’s own benefit to exhaust the afflictions, and similarly, it does not benefit others.

original: 'o brgyal gang ni chos bstan pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'o brgyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'o brgyal gang ni chos bstan pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'o brgyal ba'o //
translated: What is the trouble? It is the trouble of teaching the Dharma and so on.

original: de'i slad du ni gdul bya de rnams kyi don du'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du ni gdul bya de rnams kyi don du'o //
translated: For that reason, it is for the sake of those disciples.

original: de la lan go ci zhig lon pa ni lan go ci zhig lon pa ste /
analyzed: de la lan go ci zhig lon pa ni lan go ci zhig lon pa ste /
translated: What is the repayment? It is the repayment.

original: lan med pa zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lan med pa zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: “Without repayment” is the intention.

original: de lta bas na re zhig khyod la de rnams la lan mi ldon pa de rnams la khyod ji ltar slar sman pa mdzad ce na //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig khyod la de rnams la lan mi ldon pa de rnams la khyod ji ltar slar sman pa mdzad ce na //
translated: Therefore, how do you, who do not repay them, benefit them in return?

original: smras pa / khyod ni sems can gnyid log @172a * //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod ni sems can gnyid log @172a * //
translated: He said: You are the watchman who looks

original: pa'i ; / rgyud la gzigs pa'i zhugs tse ba //🔽bag med gyur pa rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: pa'i ; / rgyud la gzigs pa'i zhugs tse ba // bag med gyur pa rnams kyi ni //
translated: at the life-stream of sleeping sentient beings.🔽You are the good friend of those who are

original: grogs bzang bag dang bcas pa lags //
analyzed: grogs bzang bag dang bcas pa lags //
translated: careless.

original: khyod ni sems can gnyid log pa'i //
analyzed: khyod ni sems can gnyid log pa'i //
translated: You are the watchman of sleeping sentient beings.

original: zhugs tse ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs tse ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: The word “watchman” is an extension.

original: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: You are the Lord.

original: ni ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: The word “ni” means “because”.

original: zhugs tse ba ni mi shes pa'i gnyid las sangs pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs tse ba ni mi shes pa'i gnyid las sangs pa ste /
translated: A watchman is one who is awake from the sleep of ignorance.

original: gzhan la phan pa sgrub par rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa sgrub par rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is one who strives to accomplish the welfare of others.

original: sems can gnyid log pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gnyid log pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “sleeping sentient beings” will be explained.

original: rmugs pa'i gnyid kyis ye shes kyi spyan bkag pa'i phyir sems can rnams gnyid log pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa'i gnyid kyis ye shes kyi spyan bkag pa'i phyir sems can rnams gnyid log pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are asleep because the sleep of delusion obstructs the eye of wisdom.

original: rgyud ni sems can rnams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni sems can rnams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “life-stream” is connected with “sentient beings”.

original: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so la gzigs pa'i zhugs tse ba'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so la gzigs pa'i zhugs tse ba'o //
translated: The word “looks” means that he is the watchman who looks at each one.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa ni nyin lan gsum dang mtshan lan gsum du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gang 'grib pa dang / gang 'phel ba dang / gang nyon mongs pa nyam nga ba'i gnod pa dang ldan pa la bdag gis gang sdug bsngal nyam nga ba'i gnod pa dang ldan pa dgol bar bya zhes sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa ni nyin lan gsum dang mtshan lan gsum du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gang 'grib pa dang / gang 'phel ba dang / gang nyon mongs pa nyam nga ba'i gnod pa dang ldan pa la bdag gis gang sdug bsngal nyam nga ba'i gnod pa dang ldan pa dgol bar bya zhes sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: He speaks the truth, for he sees the world with the eye of a Buddha three times each day and three times each night, thinking, “Who is declining and who advancing? Who is in pain, who is happy? Who is in want, who is not? Who is virtuous, who is not? Who is to be pitied, who is not? Who is in trouble, who is not? Who is in danger, who is not? Who is declining, who is advancing? Who is difficult to discipline, who is easy to discipline? Whom shall I discipline? Whom shall I lead? Whom shall I set free? Whom shall I establish in the fruit of a holy life? Whom shall I bring to perfection?”

original: bag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i dus las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i dus las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: “The heedful” means those who do not pass beyond the time for the ripening of their roots of virtue.

original: bag med pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: “The heedless” means those who do not abide in virtue.🔽For this reason, you are a friend, because you are a good friend, a supreme healer.🔽You are a healer because

original: rgyu de'i phyir khyod ni grogs bzang bas na grogs te mchog tu sman pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di las kyang sman pa ste /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir khyod ni grogs bzang bas na grogs te mchog tu sman pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di las kyang sman pa ste /🔽gang gi phyir /
translated: you are

original: khyod kyis nyon mongs gzhom pa bshad //
analyzed: khyod kyis nyon mongs gzhom pa bshad //
translated: You have explained the destruction of the afflictions.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad pa ni /
translated: The two verses beginning with “You have explained the destruction of the afflictions”

original: khyod kyis nyon mongs gzhom pa bshad //
analyzed: khyod kyis nyon mongs gzhom pa bshad //
translated: You have explained the destruction of the afflictions.

original: bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad //
analyzed: bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad //
translated: You have revealed the deceptions of Mara.

original: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mi bzad brjod //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mi bzad brjod //
translated: You have described the terrible nature of cyclic existence.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs kyang bstan //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs kyang bstan //
translated: You have shown the direction of fearlessness.

original: phan dgongs thugs rje can gyis ni //
analyzed: phan dgongs thugs rje can gyis ni //
translated: You, who are compassionate and intent on benefiting,

original: sems can rnams la bgyi 'tshal ba //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bgyi 'tshal ba //
translated: Have done for sentient beings

original: gang zhig khyod kyis ma mdzad pa //
analyzed: gang zhig khyod kyis ma mdzad pa //
translated: Whatever needed to be done.

original: gzhan go ci zhig mchis lags kyi //
analyzed: gzhan go ci zhig mchis lags kyi //
translated: What else is there to do?

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The afflictions are desire and so on.

original: gzhom pa ni gnyen por bshad do //
analyzed: gzhom pa ni gnyen por bshad do //
translated: Their destruction is explained as their antidote.

original: dge slong dag 'dod chags kyi nad chen po'i mi sdug pa'i sman chen po dang / yang na mi sdug pa bsgos pa'o /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod chags kyi nad chen po'i mi sdug pa'i sman chen po dang / yang na mi sdug pa bsgos pa'o /
translated: “Monks, the great medicine for the disease of desire is the great ugliness, or the meditation on ugliness.

original: @172b zhe sdang gi byams pa dang / yang na byams pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: @172b zhe sdang gi byams pa dang / yang na byams pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The medicine for the disease of hatred is love, or the meditation on love.

original: dge slong dag gti mug gi nad chen po'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor rtog pa sman chen po dang / yang na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor rtog pa bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong dag gti mug gi nad chen po'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor rtog pa sman chen po dang / yang na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor rtog pa bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go //
translated: Monks, the great disease of delusion is the great medicine of discerning dependent origination, or the cultivation of discerning dependent origination is what the sutra passage says.

original: yang na ci rigs par nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs par nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, as appropriate, the antidote to all afflictions is explained as the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal ba bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal ba bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the victory over the demon of afflictions,

original: bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad //
analyzed: bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad //
translated: he taught the deceptions of Mara.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis lha'i bu'i bdud kyi g-yo bstan pas bu lon med pa bshad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis lha'i bu'i bdud kyi g-yo bstan pas bu lon med pa bshad do //
translated: By the phrase he taught the deceptions of Mara, the absence of debt is explained.

original: bdud kyi g-yo ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i yul bsdus pa de bstan pa ni bstan pa mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdud kyi g-yo ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i yul bsdus pa de bstan pa ni bstan pa mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The deception of Mara is the teaching of the objects of pleasant and unpleasant sounds. He taught means he explained.

original: ji ltar mdo las gsungs pa ni dge slong rnams 'dir bdud glags skabs lta ba dang / glags tshol ba dang / glags skabs la 'jug pas mig gis shes par bya ba gzugs sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las gsungs pa ni dge slong rnams 'dir bdud glags skabs lta ba dang / glags tshol ba dang / glags skabs la 'jug pas mig gis shes par bya ba gzugs sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang /
translated: He looks with his eyes at forms that are attractive, delightful, agreeable,🔽pleasing, arousing desire, and connected with desire.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags pas bltas nas drung du 'dren par byed pa de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro dang / lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags pas bltas nas drung du 'dren par byed pa de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro dang / lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya ba dang /
translated: In the same way, he listens with his ears to sounds, smells with his nose scents, tastes with his tongue flavors, touches with his body touchables,

original: yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos te /
analyzed: yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos te /
translated: and cognizes with his mind mental phenomena.

original: drug po rtag par gnas pa la nye bar 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: drug po rtag par gnas pa la nye bar 'dren par byed do //
translated: He always seeks to lead them to the presence of the six.

original: de'i phyir dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi sems kyis kun du bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi sems kyis kun du bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should protect your mind with mindfulness and vigilance.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs mthong ba na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs mthong ba na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
translated: When you see such forms, do not be happy or unhappy.

original: shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should abide in equanimity with vigilance.

original: dper na gnas brten legs sad sgom pa po 'jigs pa chen po dang ldan pa'i drung du bdud 'ongs pas de 'jigs pas de lta bu'i rab tu byed pa bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
analyzed: dper na gnas brten legs sad sgom pa po 'jigs pa chen po dang ldan pa'i drung du bdud 'ongs pas de 'jigs pas de lta bu'i rab tu byed pa bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
translated: For example, the elder Susīma, a meditator, was approached by Māra, who was greatly frightened. Out of fear, he asked the Blessed One about such a treatise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sdig pa can gyi bdud de song bas dogs pa med par bsam gtan gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi bdud de song bas dogs pa med par bsam gtan gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: That sinful Māra has gone. Meditate without fear.

original: slar yang de nags su phyin nas sgom pa la de bzhin du slar yang bdud der 'ongs so //
analyzed: slar yang de nags su phyin nas sgom pa la de bzhin du slar yang bdud der 'ongs so //
translated: Again, he went to the forest to meditate. Again, that Māra came.

original: gnas brten gyis tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: gnas brten gyis tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: The elder spoke a verse:

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: With whatever form you desire,

original: nga la bslu bar mi nus @173a * //
analyzed: nga la bslu bar mi nus @173a * //
translated: you cannot deceive me.

original: so // khyod kyi g-yo ni bsal bas na //🔽nga yi gan du khyod ni nyams //
analyzed: so // khyod kyi g-yo ni bsal bas na // nga yi gan du khyod ni nyams //
translated: By dispelling your deceit,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: you are defeated before me.

original: de ltar bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdud kyi g-yo dag bstan pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: Thus he revealed the deceptions of Māra.

original: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mi bzad brjod //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mi bzad brjod //
translated: The nature of cyclic existence is said to be terrible.

original: ces bya ba ni thams cad don dang mi ldan pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin no//
analyzed: ces bya ba ni thams cad don dang mi ldan pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin no//
translated: This is the source of all that is meaningless.

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa la khyed cag dag gi yun ring por mi bzad pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / ma'i mngal du khrag gi thig le nye bar blang ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa la khyed cag dag gi yun ring por mi bzad pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / ma'i mngal du khrag gi thig le nye bar blang ba dang /
translated: Monks, cyclic existence is beginningless and endless. For a long time you have experienced terrible, painful, and unpleasant feelings. You have taken up the state of being a drop of blood in a mother’s womb.

original: lan mang por dmyal ba dang / lan mang por dud 'gro dang ; lan mang por yi dags te lan mang por ngan 'gror lhung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go //
analyzed: lan mang por dmyal ba dang / lan mang por dud 'gro dang ; lan mang por yi dags te lan mang por ngan 'gror lhung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go //
translated: You have fallen many times into the miserable states of existence, many times into the animal realm, many times into the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The state of fearlessness is called nirvana because it is not tainted by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the sutra, “Nirvana is peace.”

original: de bstan zhes bya ba ni bstan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bstan zhes bya ba ni bstan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of he taught is the meaning of he taught.

original: gzhan go ci zhig ma mdzad pa //
analyzed: gzhan go ci zhig ma mdzad pa //
translated: What else did he not do?

original: zhes bya ba la sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sbyar ro //
translated: This is what is meant by he did not do.

original: lhag ma med ces bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med ces bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: Without remainder is the intention.

original: phan dgongs zhes bya ba ni phan pa dgongs pa gang la mnga' ba de ni phan dgongs te gzhan la phan pa'i dgongs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phan dgongs zhes bya ba ni phan pa dgongs pa gang la mnga' ba de ni phan dgongs te gzhan la phan pa'i dgongs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The one who has the intention to benefit is the one who has the intention to benefit. The intention to benefit others is the intention.

original: thugs rje can ni thugs rjes mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje can ni thugs rjes mdzad pa'o //
translated: The compassionate one is the one who acts compassionately.

original: bgyi 'tshal ba ni bgyi 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: bgyi 'tshal ba ni bgyi 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The one who wishes to do is the one who wishes to do.

original: gang zhig bgyi 'tshal ba ma mdzad pa ni mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig bgyi 'tshal ba ma mdzad pa ni mdzad pa ste /
translated: The one who did not do what was to be done is the one who did.

original: thams cad gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is he did everything to benefit others.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das ni dge ba tshad med pa la mkhas pa yin na ji ltar dge ba ma yin pa lhas byin la sogs pa dang / dge ba nyam chung ba kho bo cag dang 'dra ba la nyid kyi dge ba stsal nas phan dgongs ma mdzad pa yin zhe na zhes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das ni dge ba tshad med pa la mkhas pa yin na ji ltar dge ba ma yin pa lhas byin la sogs pa dang / dge ba nyam chung ba kho bo cag dang 'dra ba la nyid kyi dge ba stsal nas phan dgongs ma mdzad pa yin zhe na zhes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Well then, the Lord is skilled in immeasurable virtue. Why is it that he does not consider it beneficial to bestow his own virtue upon the non-virtuous Devadatta and so forth, and upon the weak in virtue, like us?

original: gal te chos ni 'di dag dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis slob dpon gyis smras so //
analyzed: gal te chos ni 'di dag dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis slob dpon gyis smras so //
translated: For that reason, the Master states two verses:🔽If these phenomena

original: gal te chos ni 'di dag dang // spo ba zhig tu btub na ni //
analyzed: gal te chos ni 'di dag dang // spo ba zhig tu btub na ni //
translated: could be transferred,

original: gdon mi 'tshal bar khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: gdon mi 'tshal bar khyod kyis ni //
translated: then you would certainly

original: lhas byin la brten kun la stsal //
analyzed: lhas byin la brten kun la stsal //
translated: bestow them upon Devadatta.

original: de slad 'gro la brda sprod pa //🔽'gro ba'i mgon po khyod kyis ni //🔽'di la phan tshun byed pa po //
analyzed: de slad 'gro la brda sprod pa // 'gro ba'i mgon po khyod kyis ni // 'di la phan tshun byed pa po //
translated: Therefore, the Guide of Beings🔽has taught that here

original: med pa skad du nges par gsungs //
analyzed: med pa skad du nges par gsungs //
translated: there is no mutual agent.

original: spo ba zhig tu btub na ni //
analyzed: spo ba zhig tu btub na ni //
translated: If they could be transferred,

original: zhes bya ba'i bsam pas @173b gal te'i sgra dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bsam pas @173b gal te'i sgra dang sbyar ro //
translated: the word “if” is connected with the thought of “could be transferred.”

original: spo ba zhig tu btub na ni rgyud gzhan la snyegs pa'o //
analyzed: spo ba zhig tu btub na ni rgyud gzhan la snyegs pa'o //
translated: If it were possible to transfer it, it would be transferred to another continuum.

original: chos ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: btub ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: btub ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Possible” means “capable of being done.”

original: 'di dag ni sngar bshad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngar bshad pa'i chos so //
translated: These are the Dharmas explained above.

original: gdon mi 'tshal bar ni nges par ro //
analyzed: gdon mi 'tshal bar ni nges par ro //
translated: “Without fail” means “certainly.”

original: lhas byin ni shin tu gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhas byin ni shin tu gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Devadatta is the one who does great harm.

original: brten ni brtsams nas so //
analyzed: brten ni brtsams nas so //
translated: “Having relied” means “having undertaken.”

original: kun la stsal ba ni bkod par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun la stsal ba ni bkod par gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having given to all” means “having arranged.”

original: gang gi phyir spo ba zhig tu mi btub pa de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spo ba zhig tu mi btub pa de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is not possible to transfer it, therefore it is said “Protector of the world” and so on.

original: rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means “for that cause.”

original: de ltar phan par mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan par mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: Because of that benefit, it is said “Protector of the world.”

original: 'di na 'khor bar gang zag gzhan byed pa po ma yin te rang kho na'i las 'di ni byed ces de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di na 'khor bar gang zag gzhan byed pa po ma yin te rang kho na'i las 'di ni byed ces de skad du gsungs so //
translated: Here, in saṃsāra, there is no other person who is the agent; only one’s own karma is the agent. This is what is said.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Certainly” means “without doubt.”

original: 'gro ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad do //
translated: The world is all worldly people.

original: brda sprod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos su tshig gis brda sprod pa yin te /
analyzed: brda sprod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos su tshig gis brda sprod pa yin te /
translated: The term grammarians refers to those who directly teach grammar.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi rgyud la spo ba zhig tu mi btub pas chos rnams kyi don gyi go ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi rgyud la spo ba zhig tu mi btub pas chos rnams kyi don gyi go ba'o //
translated: However, since they are unable to transfer it to the mindstreams of others, it is the understanding of the meaning of the teachings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di na phan tshun byed pa po med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di na phan tshun byed pa po med pa ste /
translated: Here there is no mutual agent.

original: gzhan du na nges khyed cag la rang gi chos spo ba zhig tu btub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na nges khyed cag la rang gi chos spo ba zhig tu btub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, it would be possible for you to transfer your own teachings, is the condensed meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can la sman pa mdzad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod par bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can la sman pa mdzad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod par bstan to //
translated: In the state of a bodhisattva, the Blessed One's practice of benefiting sentient beings is taught through praise of the perfections.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob nas bzhugs par mdzad pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad do //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob nas bzhugs par mdzad pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad do //
translated: What is to be done by attaining the state of the Sugata has been explained before.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can la rjes su brtse bas kyang //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can la rjes su brtse bas kyang //
translated: Also, through subsequent compassion for future sentient beings,

original: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
translated: out of compassion for the worlds,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad pa ni /🔽'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad pa ni / 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
translated: These two verses explain the above.🔽He taught the true Dharma for a long time on the surface of the earth,

original: yun ring sa steng dam chos bshad //
analyzed: yun ring sa steng dam chos bshad //
translated: out of compassion for the world.🔽He also produced many holy disciples

original: 'jig rten gsum phan 'dogs nus pa'i //🔽slob ma dam pa'ang mang du bskrun //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum phan 'dogs nus pa'i // slob ma dam pa'ang mang du bskrun //
translated: who were able to benefit the three worlds.🔽The multitude of disciples to be trained

original: mngon du gdul bya'i tshogs kyang ni //🔽mdzes bzang yan chad btul lags pas //🔽yun ring zhes smos la //
analyzed: mngon du gdul bya'i tshogs kyang ni // mdzes bzang yan chad btul lags pas // yun ring zhes smos la //
translated: were trained up to Sudarshana.🔽The word “long” is used because

original: yun ring zhes bya ba ni tshig phrad kyi don to //
analyzed: yun ring zhes bya ba ni tshig phrad kyi don to //
translated: the word “long” has the meaning of a long time.

original: sa steng ni mi'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: sa steng ni mi'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The “surface of the earth” is the human world.

original: dam chos ni lung gi bdag nyid de yun ring bshad ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dam chos ni lung gi bdag nyid de yun ring bshad ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The “true Dharma” is the nature of the scriptures. It is connected with the words “for a long time he taught.”

original: gzhan dang gzhan du yun ring por bzhag nas de nyid lha dang mi rnams kyi @174a * //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du yun ring por bzhag nas de nyid lha dang mi rnams kyi @174a * //
translated: After establishing it for a long time in different places, he placed it in the hands of gods and men.

original: bzung ba nga'i bstan pa ni lo lnga stong gi bar du mi nub par gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung ba nga'i bstan pa ni lo lnga stong gi bar du mi nub par gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He said, “My teaching will remain for five thousand years without decline.”

original: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse bas //
translated: Out of compassion for the world

original: zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi don ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi don ma yin te /
translated: This is not for his own sake.

original: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la sman pa mdzad par bzhed pa yis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la sman pa mdzad par bzhed pa yis so //
translated: But he does it out of a desire to help future generations.

original: slob ma mang po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: slob ma mang po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa ste /
translated: His many disciples are the elders Mahakasyapa and so on.

original: slob ma mang po de rnams bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma mang po de rnams bskrun pa'o //
translated: He has produced many disciples.

original: ji ltar slar yang de rnams bskrun par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar slar yang de rnams bskrun par mdzad ce na /
translated: How has he produced them?

original: de rnams kyi rgyud nyid la 'phags pa'i khams bskrun par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyud nyid la 'phags pa'i khams bskrun par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has produced the noble element in their own mental continua.

original: yang na khams rnams ni don ma yin pa'i phyir mang du bskrun zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na khams rnams ni don ma yin pa'i phyir mang du bskrun zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, he has produced many elements, because the elements are not a self.

original: slob ma dam pa dang nges par sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob ma dam pa dang nges par sbyar ro //
translated: He is connected with the highest disciples.

original: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse ba ni bstan pa la gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la thugs brtse ba ni bstan pa la gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His compassion for the world is because he causes them to abide in the teaching.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽'jig rten gsum phan 'dogs nus pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / 'jig rten gsum phan 'dogs nus pa ste /
translated: How does he do that?🔽He is able to benefit the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum ste /
translated: The three worlds are the three realms.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni mtho ris dang thar pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid la nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzhan yang / mngon du gdul bya'i tshogs kyang ni //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni mtho ris dang thar pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid la nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan yang / mngon du gdul bya'i tshogs kyang ni //
translated: The meaning of ability is the characteristic of attaining heaven and liberation.🔽Moreover, it is said, The assembly of disciples to be manifestly tamed...

original: zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Here,

original: mngon du btul ba'i tshogs ni mngon du btul ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: mngon du btul ba'i tshogs ni mngon du btul ba'i tshogs so //
translated: the assembly of those manifestly tamed is the assembly of those manifestly tamed.

original: btul ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: btul ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of taming:

original: nyan thos kyis btul ba dang ; sangs rgyas kyis btul ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis btul ba dang ; sangs rgyas kyis btul ba'o //
translated: taming by śrāvakas and taming by buddhas.

original: de la gang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis btul ba de ni mngon du btul ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de la gang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis btul ba de ni mngon du btul ba'i tshogs so //
translated: Among those, the taming by the Blessed One himself is the assembly of those manifestly tamed.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon du btul ba'i tshogs de ni 'phags pa kun shes koo ndi n+ya la sogs pa nas mdzes bzang yan chad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon du btul ba'i tshogs de ni 'phags pa kun shes koo ndi n+ya la sogs pa nas mdzes bzang yan chad ces bya ba'o //
translated: In that, the assembly of those manifestly tamed by the Blessed One is from the noble Ājñātakauṇḍinya and so forth up to Sundarananda.

original: mdzes bzang zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: mdzes bzang zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba ste /
translated: Sundarananda is one who has gone forth.

original: kun gyi mthar bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: kun gyi mthar bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa nyid du gzhag go //
translated: At the end of all, at the time of the Blessed One's parinirvāṇa, he was established in arhatship.

original: de gang gi mtha' na yod pa de ni mdzes bzang yan chad de /
analyzed: de gang gi mtha' na yod pa de ni mdzes bzang yan chad de /
translated: That which is at the end of that is the end of the beautiful, i.e., the end of the world.

original: de btul ba ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa'o //🔽da go khyod la sems can gyi //
analyzed: de btul ba ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa'o // da go khyod la sems can gyi //
translated: Having subdued that, he has established them in the result of arhatship, etc.🔽Now, what is the remainder of the debt

original: bu lon lhag ma ci mchis na //
analyzed: bu lon lhag ma ci mchis na //
translated: of sentient beings to you?

original: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: In this way, by the vajra-samādhi,

original: sku gdung til 'bru bzhin blags nas //
analyzed: sku gdung til 'bru bzhin blags nas //
translated: your relics will be scattered like sesame seeds.

original: bu lon lhag ma ci mchis na //
analyzed: bu lon lhag ma ci mchis na //
translated: What is the remainder of the debt?

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par //
translated: This is the distinction.

original: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: There is not even the slightest remainder, is the intention.

original: sems @174b can gyi zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems @174b can gyi zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Of sentient beings means of sentient beings.

original: bu lon ltag ma ci mchis dang // zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bu lon ltag ma ci mchis dang // zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The remainder of the debt is to be connected with the above.

original: de lta bu ni 'dir sems can rnams dam pa'i chos la bkod pa'i phyir bu lon med pa bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'dir sems can rnams dam pa'i chos la bkod pa'i phyir bu lon med pa bshad do //
translated: In this way, here the absence of debt is explained in order to establish sentient beings in the true Dharma.

original: gzugs sku'i dbye bas bu lon med par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs sku'i dbye bas bu lon med par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The absence of debt should be explained by the division of the form body.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: In this way, by the vajra-samādhi,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By this and the rest,

original: khyod kyis yal bar ma bor ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis yal bar ma bor ro //
translated: you did not abandon

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: is to be connected.

original: sku ma lus pa phye mar blags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin kho na rdo rje ste rdo rje de yis so //
analyzed: sku ma lus pa phye mar blags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin kho na rdo rje ste rdo rje de yis so //
translated: Because of grinding up the entire body into powder, only the samadhi is the vajra, and with that vajra.

original: til 'bru bzhin zhes bya ba ni til 'bru'i cha dang ldan pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: til 'bru bzhin zhes bya ba ni til 'bru'i cha dang ldan pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: Like sesame seeds means by the division of the parts of sesame seeds.

original: sku gdung ni nyid kyi sku las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sku gdung ni nyid kyi sku las byung ba'o //
translated: The relics are what come from one's own body.

original: blags pa ni mtshan dang rgyu'i bya ba la sha dre zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blags pa ni mtshan dang rgyu'i bya ba la sha dre zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Grinding means that the verb to grind becomes to grind in the action of the sign and the cause.

original: sku gdung blags pas ni dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ba mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: sku gdung blags pas ni dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ba mtshon par bya ste /
translated: By grinding up the relics, one should indicate that one did not abandon the difficult practices.

original: ji ltar rtsis mkhan gnas kyi rjes su ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsis mkhan gnas kyi rjes su ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as in the case of an accountant, it is called instruction following the place.

original: mjug tu'ang khyod kyis shin tu ni //
analyzed: mjug tu'ang khyod kyis shin tu ni //
translated: At the end, too, you did not abandon🔽difficult practices

original: dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ro //
analyzed: dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ro //
translated: at all🔽These forms and dharmas

original: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes //
translated: are only for the benefit of others.

original: dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ba ni shin tu gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: dka' spyad yal bar ma bor ba ni shin tu gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning the practice of austerities is the activity of benefiting others.

original: mjug tu'ang zhes bya ba ni smon lam 'ba' zhig la brten par ma zad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi snga rol du'o //
analyzed: mjug tu'ang zhes bya ba ni smon lam 'ba' zhig la brten par ma zad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi snga rol du'o //
translated: At the end means not only relying on the vow, but also before the time of complete nirvana.

original: yal bar ma bor ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang yal bar ma bor ba'o //
analyzed: yal bar ma bor ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang yal bar ma bor ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning means not abandoning even at the time of complete nirvana.

original: de lta bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe 'jig rten pas sku gdung las gzugs brnyan byas nas nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das na yang mtho ris dang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sku gdung ting nge
analyzed: de lta bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe 'jig rten pas sku gdung las gzugs brnyan byas nas nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das na yang mtho ris dang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sku gdung ting nge
translated: Therefore, at the time of complete nirvana, the worldly create images from the relics, thinking Even after the Buddha's nirvana, we will go to heaven and liberation. Thus, the Blessed One himself, by the power of concentration, arranged the relics.

original: 'dzin gyi stobs kyis blags so zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin gyi stobs kyis blags so zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: This is the scriptural reference.

original: yang na dam pa'i chos bzhag pa dang / sku gdung blags pas bu lon med pa blags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i chos bzhag pa dang / sku gdung blags pas bu lon med pa blags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, by establishing the true Dharma and arranging the relics, the debt would not be repaid.

original: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The form body and these teachings are for the benefit of others alone.

original: gzhan don ni gzhan gyi dgos pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan don ni gzhan gyi dgos pa dag go //
translated: The benefit of others is the purpose of others.

original: kho na zhes bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kho na zhes bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Alone means exclusively.

original: chos ni gsung rab bo //
analyzed: chos ni gsung rab bo //
translated: The teachings are the scriptures.

original: gzugs kyi sku ni sku zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni sku zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The form body is called the body.

original: de ltar na /🔽'jig rten yid ches dka' 'di la //
analyzed: de ltar na / 'jig rten yid ches dka' 'di la //
translated: Thus,🔽you have shown nirvana in this world,

original: khyod kyis mya ngan 'das pa bstan //
analyzed: khyod kyis mya ngan 'das pa bstan //
translated: which is difficult to believe.

original: de slad @175a * //🔽chos sku ma lus pa //
analyzed: de slad @175a * // chos sku ma lus pa //
translated: Therefore,🔽you have entrusted the entire Dharma body

original: sras kyi mchog la gtad mdzad de //
analyzed: sras kyi mchog la gtad mdzad de //
translated: to the supreme son.

original: yid ches dka' ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches dka' ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa med pa'o //
translated: Difficult to believe means faithless.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i skye bo la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i skye bo la'o //
translated: In this world means among the people of Jambudvipa.

original: mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phung po'i lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na yang ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phung po'i lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na yang ngo //
translated: Nirvana means not only in a certain state, but also in the complete nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: bstan pa ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni bstan pa ste /
translated: Shown means taught.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word you is supplied.

original: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes bya ba de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / gzhan don kho nar mdzad do zhes bya ba de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: The statement He has made this Dharma and his embodiment in form exclusively for the benefit of others is explained.

original: de slad sras kyi mchog la gtad mdzad de //
analyzed: de slad sras kyi mchog la gtad mdzad de //
translated: Therefore, he entrusted it to the foremost of his sons.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extended explanation.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The word it refers to the teaching.

original: slad ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: slad ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word therefore means because.

original: sras ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo dang / 'od srungs la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sras ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo dang / 'od srungs la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The word sons refers to the noble Ananda, Kasyapa, and so on.

original: gtad mdzad ni gtad par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gtad mdzad ni gtad par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Entrusted means entrusted to them.

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na 'od srungs khyod kyis bstan pa'i bya ba gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na 'od srungs khyod kyis bstan pa'i bya ba gyis shig pa'o //
translated: When I have passed into final nirvar:ia, Kasyapa, you must perform the duties of the teaching.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na yang dge slong kun dga' bo la khyod kyis bstan pa zungs shig ces bsgo nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na yang dge slong kun dga' bo la khyod kyis bstan pa zungs shig ces bsgo nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: When I have passed into final nirvar:ia, Ananda, you must hold the teaching. Having thus instructed them, he will pass into final nirvar:ia.

original: khyod kyi chos kyi sku ni gsung rab ste /
analyzed: khyod kyi chos kyi sku ni gsung rab ste /

original: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba ma lus pa'o //

analyzed: gzugs sku til 'bru ltar bshig nas // khyod ni yongs su mya ngan 'das //

translated: Having destroyed the form body of the Lord, like a sesame seed, by the division of its parts, like sesame seeds, you have attained complete extinction, the extinction without remainder of the aggregates.

original: gang gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / ces sngar bshad pa de bshad do //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi sku dang chos 'di dag / ces sngar bshad pa de bshad do //

original: bu lon med par bstod pa bshad pa dang / de bzhin du dbye ba brgyad kyis phan pa mdzad pa yang ste /
analyzed: bu lon med par bstod pa bshad pa dang / de bzhin du dbye ba brgyad kyis phan pa mdzad pa yang ste /

analyzed: bu lon med par bstod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste le'u bcu gsum pa'o /

original: ae ma'o gnas pa ae ma'o tshul //🔽ae ma'o yon tan ae ma'o sku //
analyzed: ae ma'o gnas pa ae ma'o tshul // ae ma'o yon tan ae ma'o sku //

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams la //

original: ya mtshan mi che 'ga' ma mchis //
analyzed: ya mtshan mi che 'ga' ma mchis //

analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: des ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bshad do //

analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la gnas pa de yang thugs rje chen po'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa /

original: ae ma'o tshul la //
analyzed: ae ma'o tshul la //

analyzed: tshul ni spyod pa ste dgongs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: des ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa yin pa'i phyir na ae ma'o sku'o //

original: thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ae ma'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ae ma'o //

original: yon tan ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: des ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //

analyzed: yang na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du 'phel bar gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i phyir ae ma'o //

original: yon tan ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //

original: des ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyang ngo mtshar ba zhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyang ngo mtshar ba zhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams la //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams la // zhes bya ba smos pa la //
translated: In the Buddha’s qualities

original: ni'i sgra ni las blangs pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni las blangs pa'o //
translated: The word “in” is used in the sense of “from”.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mi 'jigs pa dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa rnams te ma mchis pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mi 'jigs pa dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa rnams te ma mchis pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The Buddha’s qualities are the powers, the great compassion, and so on. “ Non-existence” is connected with this.

analyzed: 'ga' zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi nang na chos gzhan no //

original: khyod la 'od sdang bar bgyid pa yi ;
analyzed: khyod la 'od sdang bar bgyid pa yi ;
translated: your body, speech, and activities are pacified.

original: / rmongs pa mi bzad pa la gzigs //
analyzed: / rmongs pa mi bzad pa la gzigs //

analyzed: phan 'dogs mdzad cing blta na sdug / ces bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //

original: de la phan 'dogs pa ni khyod ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa ni khyod ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: de la zhe sdang gi rgyu dang bral ba khyod la sdang @176a * //

original: rmongs pa mi bzad pa la gzigs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rmongs pa mi bzad pa la gzigs // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gzigs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas bskyed pa dang 'dra ba'i tshig phrad de /

analyzed: bya ba mngon du gyur pa dang rtse gcig pa la 'jug pa'o //

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //

original: mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'o //

analyzed: khyod kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid // tshad ma mchis la bsam mi khyab //

analyzed: bstan min grangs kyang ma mchis pa //

original: bstan min grangs kyang ma mchis pa //
analyzed: bstan min grangs kyang ma mchis pa //
