translated: “Immeasurable” means that they cannot be measured.

original: yon tan gyi nus pa gcig kyang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi nus pa gcig kyang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to understand even one of his virtues.

original: gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyis bgrang mi nus pas na grangs kyang ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyis bgrang mi nus pas na grangs kyang ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Since they cannot be enumerated by numbers such as one, they are also innumerable.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their qualities are infinite.

original: sangs rgyas las sems can gzhan gyi yul ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las sems can gzhan gyi yul ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Since they are not the objects of other beings, they are inconceivable.

original: bstan pa ni dpe'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni dpe'o //
translated: The term “example” means “illustration.”

original: bstan min ni dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan min ni dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “non-example” means “without illustration.”

original: bdag nyid ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “By themselves” means “by their own power.”

original: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o //🔽bdag @177a * //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o // bdag @177a * //
translated: The term “own” is a determinative compound.

original: nyid kyis ni nyan thos kyi mchog dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyis ni nyan thos kyi mchog dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: “By themselves” means “not by the supreme disciples or the solitary realizers.”

original: bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi sgra'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi sgra'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The term “own” is a synonym for “self.”

original: dper na 'jig rten pa kha cig smra ba ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis bdag grong du 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa kha cig smra ba ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis bdag grong du 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, some worldly people say, “I will go to town by my own power.”

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dang gzugs kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dang gzugs kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: “By themselves” means “by the essence of the body of truth and by the essence of the body of form.”

original: khyod ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ces bya ba ni nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “You” refers to the ascertainment.

original: ci zhig nges par 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig nges par 'dzin zhe na /
translated: What is ascertained?

original: kha cig 'di skad smra bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad smra bar byed de /
translated: Some say this:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang sh'akya'i sras dang dus mnyam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ba de dag phan tshun yon tan rgyas par mkhyen pa zhes bya bas na de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang sh'akya'i sras dang dus mnyam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ba de dag phan tshun yon tan rgyas par mkhyen pa zhes bya bas na de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “There are other world systems where Bhagavat Buddhas arise simultaneously with the son of the Śākyas.  They know each other’s qualities in detail.  To refute them,

original: nges par 'dzin pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa khyod nyid kyis bdag nyid mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa khyod nyid kyis bdag nyid mkhyen gyi /
translated: the ascertainment is that only you, Bhagavat Śākyamuni, know yourself.

original: gzhan gyis ni rngo mi thogs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni rngo mi thogs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others cannot do it.”

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das snga ma dang phyi ma'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'jig rten du dus mnyam du 'byung ba de ni gnas dang go skabs med do zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig go //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das snga ma dang phyi ma'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'jig rten du dus mnyam du 'byung ba de ni gnas dang go skabs med do zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the sūtra passage: “It is impossible and inconceivable that two Tathāgatas, Foe Destroyers, Perfectly Complete Buddhas could arise in the world without one preceding and the other following.”

original: de bas na khyod kho nas bdag nyid mkhyen pa'i mchod 'os yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kho nas bdag nyid mkhyen pa'i mchod 'os yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, you alone are worthy of worship because you know yourself.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: But not for the śrāvakas, etc.

original: kho bo cag mi gtsang ba'i srin bu dang 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag mi gtsang ba'i srin bu dang 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What need is there to speak of us, who are like worms in filth?

original: de'i phyir na khyod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir na khyod kyi /
translated: Therefore, you:

original: mtsho chen chab ni bas par ma gyur kyang //
analyzed: mtsho chen chab ni bas par ma gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the great ocean’s water is not exhausted,

original: skye bo'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bgyid ltar //
analyzed: skye bo'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bgyid ltar //
translated: it completely alleviates the distress of beings.

original: khyod kyi yon tan cha tsam ma bsgrags kyang //
analyzed: khyod kyi yon tan cha tsam ma bsgrags kyang //
translated: Even though a mere portion of your good qualities is not proclaimed,

original: bdag ni mchog tu glo ba dga' zhing mchis //
analyzed: bdag ni mchog tu glo ba dga' zhing mchis //
translated: I am supremely delighted.

original: khyod kyi yon tan cha tsam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyod kyi yon tan cha tsam zhes bya ba la /
translated: A mere portion of your good qualities means

original: yon tan rnams kyi cha ni cha ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyi cha ni cha ste /
translated: a portion of the good qualities is a portion.

original: de'i sgra tsam gyi rtse mo ste nyung ngu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i sgra tsam gyi rtse mo ste nyung ngu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mere sound of that is the peak, the small amount, the meaning of “a mere portion.”

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das khyod kyi ma bsgrags pa ni ma bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das khyod kyi ma bsgrags pa ni ma bstod pa ste /
translated: That itself is not proclaimed, not praised, by you, the Blessed One.

original: yon tan thams cad lta ga las so //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad lta ga las so //
translated: How could it be all the good qualities?

original: de bzhin du yang mchog ni khyad par du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang mchog ni khyad par du'o //
translated: In the same way, supreme is special.

original: bdag ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag gi'o //
translated: I am my own.

original: dga' ba ni rangs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni rangs pa'o //
translated: Delighted is satisfied.

original: glo ba ni glo ba la mchis pa'o //
analyzed: glo ba ni glo ba la mchis pa'o //
translated: The heart is the heart.

original: yon tan gyi cha tsam ma bsgrags pas dga' bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i brgal ba'i lan bshad pa ni byas par ma gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: yon tan gyi cha tsam ma bsgrags pas dga' bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i brgal ba'i lan bshad pa ni byas par ma gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The answer to this objection is stated in the line beginning, Even though it is not exhausted.

original: bas par ma gyur zhes bya ba @177b ni bas par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bas par ma gyur zhes bya ba @177b ni bas par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Not exhausted means not exhausted.

original: mtsho chen chab ni chab po //
analyzed: mtsho chen chab ni chab po //
translated: The great ocean is full of water.

original: skye bo'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bgyid ltar ni zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bgyid ltar ni zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as it completely allays the distress of beings, so it is with peace.

original: ltar ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ltar ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: So is for the reason that.

original: de bas na tshad med pa'i yon tan gyi mtsho chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi cha tsam la bstod pas /
analyzed: de bas na tshad med pa'i yon tan gyi mtsho chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi cha tsam la bstod pas /
translated: Therefore, by praising a portion of the good qualities of the Blessed One, who is a great ocean of immeasurable good qualities,

original: bdag ni mchog tu glo ba dga' zhing mchis //
analyzed: bdag ni mchog tu glo ba dga' zhing mchis //
translated: I am supremely delighted.

original: zhes pa ste mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: da ni bstod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bsngo ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bstod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bsngo ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the dedication of the result of the praise should be explained.

original: bdag gis thub la dad pas spobs skyes pa'i //
analyzed: bdag gis thub la dad pas spobs skyes pa'i //
translated: By the arising of eloquence born of faith in the Sage,

original: dge ba'i las 'di'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis //
analyzed: dge ba'i las 'di'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis //
translated: through the arising of the result of this virtuous karma,

original: ngan rtog rlung dmar 'tshubs pas dkrugs pa yi //
analyzed: ngan rtog rlung dmar 'tshubs pas dkrugs pa yi //
translated: May the minds of beings, disturbed by the storm of evil thoughts,🔽rest in peace.

original: 'gro ba'i sems ni rnal du gnas par shog / dag pa'i las 'di'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sems ni rnal du gnas par shog / dag pa'i las 'di'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis //
translated: The result of this pure action has arisen.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive [praise].

original: 'bras bu 'khrungs pa ni 'bras bu byung ba yis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'khrungs pa ni 'bras bu byung ba yis so //
translated: The result has arisen, because the result has occurred.

original: 'di'i ni brgya lnga bcu pa'i bstod pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i ni brgya lnga bcu pa'i bstod pa las byung ba ste /
translated: This [praise] comes from the Praise in One Hundred and Fifty Verses:

original: dge ba ni ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba'i las kyi'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba'i las kyi'o //
translated: Virtue is the virtue of verbal action.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind?

original: smras pa / thub la dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thub pa la dad pa las byung ba'i spobs pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: smras pa / thub la dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thub pa la dad pa las byung ba'i spobs pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: It is said: Faith in the Sage, etc. Eloquence arising from faith in the Sage is wisdom.

original: de las skyes pa ste byung ba gang yin pa de ni thub la dad pas spobs skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa ste byung ba gang yin pa de ni thub la dad pas spobs skyes pa ste /
translated: That which arises from that, which has come forth, is born from eloquence through faith in the Sage.

original: dge ba'i las de'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i las de'i 'bras bu 'khrungs pa yis so //
translated: By the result of that virtuous action having arisen.

original: 'dod chags dang gnod sems la sogs pa ni ngan rtog go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gnod sems la sogs pa ni ngan rtog go //
translated: Evil thoughts are attachment, malice, etc.

original: de nyid yul rnams la sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir rlung dmar 'tshubs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid yul rnams la sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir rlung dmar 'tshubs pa'o //
translated: It is a storm, because it is the distraction of the mind in regard to objects.

original: de yis 'tshubs pa ni ngan rtog rlung dmar 'tshubs pas dkrugs pa'o //
analyzed: de yis 'tshubs pa ni ngan rtog rlung dmar 'tshubs pas dkrugs pa'o //
translated: It is agitated, because it is agitated by the storm of bad thoughts.🔽May the mind of beings be at peace.

original: 'gro ba'i sems ni rnal du gnas par shog / ces bya ba ni skye bo thams cad kyi sems dbang du gyur nas dgra bcom par gyur cig ces bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sems ni rnal du gnas par shog / ces bya ba ni skye bo thams cad kyi sems dbang du gyur nas dgra bcom par gyur cig ces bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the mind of all beings should be under control and become an arhat.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba brgya lnga bcu pa'i bstod pa'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba brgya lnga bcu pa'i bstod pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: Thus ends the commentary on the praise in one hundred and fifty verses, divided into cause and effect.

original: bde gshegs la bstod bshad pa yis //
analyzed: bde gshegs la bstod bshad pa yis //
translated: By explaining the praise of the Sugata,

original: bdag gis dge ba gang thob pa //
analyzed: bdag gis dge ba gang thob pa //
translated: Whatever virtue I have attained,🔽May it become the Sugata

original: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of alleviating the suffering of beings.

original: de las bde gshegs 'gyur bar shog / brgya lnga bcu pa zhes bya ba'i bstod pa'i 'grel pa dge slong dga' byed snyan pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de las bde gshegs 'gyur bar shog / brgya lnga bcu pa zhes bya ba'i bstod pa'i 'grel pa dge slong dga' byed snyan pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the praise called The One Hundred and Fifty composed by the monk Nandamitra is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po shr'i shra ddh'a ka ra wa rmma dang / lo ts'a ba sh'a kya blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la @178a * //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po shr'i shra ddh'a ka ra wa rmma dang / lo ts'a ba sh'a kya blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la @178a * //
translated: The Indian abbot Śrī Śrad-dhakara-varman and the translator Śākya Lodrö translated, revised, and finalized this.
